review_body: The location was great as the surrounding areas had much to see especially with shopping, entertainment and eateries. However, during the Winter Break, it was very crowded with Bands performing in the Dome. That's what made the shopping and eating difficult in the area as there were long lines everywhere even for elevators. But, all in all I liked the location.

I stayed here for the 59th Miss International pageant that was held at Tokyo Dome. The dome is right next to the hotel so it is very convenient to stay here if you have an event. There are also many function rooms available. The rooms were very spacious, clean - bathrooms are also very big. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Japan and these rooms are a lot larger than the usual size you find here. Short walk to the shopping centre and amusement park. Buffet breakfast was incredible!! Would definitely recommend to stay here!

We were a group that stayed for about 20 days at the hotel. The location is very convenient for getting around, and the rooms are comfortable and roomy for Tokyo standards. However, the staff were courteous but superficial at best.

Hotel rooms and in fact the entire hotel is extremely clean. I was attending a quilt show at the Tokyo Dome, which was just next door. Breakfast was very good and a large choice was available. During busy periods, there could be queues for breakfast and for the lifts. The hotel is used to dealing with international visitors and had signs/information available in English. The hotel is situated very close to a metro station, meaning that you could easily travel around Tokyo from here. There is lots to see and do in the Bunkyo area e.g. an amusement park, La Qua shoping centre and nearby gardens. There are also a wide variety of shops located here including a Don Quixote which is open 24hours a day. Lots of restaurants in the area. Felt the hotel bar and restauraunt were very over-priced, so went out for meals and drinks.

We stayed at the dome hotel in Tokyo as the quilt show was next door, the hotel was very good in cleanses but they charge you for drinking water in the room and any coffees or tea you use. No spoons and no milk providing and we asked reception if we can have some milk in the room for tea and they wanted 850 yen to charge us.Also there was no place to sit in reception areas so you have to go in the room for a chat with a friend, tv. Couldn’t get BBC NEWS AND NO ENGLISH .

For pure convenience when attending two nights of Wrestle Kingdom at the Tokyo Dome, this hotel can't be faulted.The area has plenty of options for food, albeit with a western feel (with such names as Taco Bell & TGI Fridays).The room was spacious, with a large bathroom and bed comfortable. Would definitely recommend if heading to the Dome or Korakuen Hall for events.

This is a big hotel. Located next to Tokyo Dome. During our stay there's few event at the Dome, so it's quite crowded and a bit challenge to walk around. The room is modern and clean but rather small, our room located at 34 floor. Especially if we have 2 big luggages. Check in time 3pm, check out 11am, we can't request late check out even for 1 hour due to fully book on New year's eve. From Haneda airport i took bus and got down directly at the hotel lobby. And from hotel we bought the bus ticket to Haneda airport as well. Very convenient. Per pax cost ¥1150 per trip. To go Shinjuku shopping area, only 2station using JR line.

You could do much worse than stay here. Great location close to trains and many food and shopping options. Lovely large rooms and, as is the case in numerous Japanese hotels, you get a mobile included in the cost which you can also use with Google maps to find your way around.

Stay there many times. Quite a big hotel , excellent service and nearby got many shopping place . No need to think about what to eat , resturant, food court a lot . Kid store and games station also easy found .

Nice views of Tokyo Dome (choose the amusement park's side), friendly staff, The hotel is spacious with comfortable rooms. Not far from train station, metro. Restaurant and shopping nearby, you would love your stay.

Not just a hotel. A world by itself with lots of tourist attractions nearby amidst busy streets with swarm of walking active Japanese. This is such a major landmark that first-timers need not worry reaching the hotel. All major restaurants in the vicinity. Neat and calm rooms with a view of city. Friendly staff. I enquired about something to buy with the enquiry desk and the staff was such a helpful person she provided all the details that i couldn't even imagine. So sincere in their deeds. In general, I hold Japanese high for their respecting culture and humble behaviour. One area where this hotel can improve is food. Being such a high end hotel, the cuisine is completely eastern and you don't find any Indian stuff. I was disappointed with the in-house food options. Finally, the restaurants in the vicinity helped me like TGI, KFC.

I had a room on the 41st floor with a great view of the greater Tokyo as well as the sights and sounds of the adjacent amusement park . The hotel is spacious with comfortable rooms and the staff are all very helpful and friendly. Idealy situated to the train station.
user_name:
Eric K
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Lovely hotel with exotic views of Tokyo from top floor rooms. Tokyo Dome, venue for Miss International and all the top shows is almost a part of it. Metro station, Indian Restaurant nearby, easy access to city attractions too.

I stayed at this hotel during the Rugby World Cup. The hotel was very central and close to train stations. When bored one could watch out the window and enjoy the activity at the Fun Park next door. The room facilities were very good and staff very helpful.

Ideal location for new travellers to discover and have new adventures in and around Tokyo. Excellent Friendly Service by all staff. Rooms adequate a little dated but not complaints with anything. Plenty of spaces around the theme park around the hotel with easy access to plenty of eating / drinking locations close by. Metro stations 3 entrances very close and easy to use. Felt very safe entire stay. Thinking seriously of coming back with some of our families and grandkids to interact in a new culture while they young. Overall we really enjoyed stay over a two week period broken by a trip to Kanazawa in between games.

Tokyo Dome Hotel is a good western style hotel. Very professional staff, very good breakfast. Our room had an amazing view over Tokyo. Next to the Tokyo Dome, with many restaurants and small pubs. Good value for money.

I am usually staying in this hotel only because of location. Breakfast is lousy, too crowded and very simple. Iron + board was not available. And they requested extra charge when cheking out at 11:45am (check out time 11). Hotel which should be avoided

Went to Tokyo to watch the rugby world cup. The hotel is perfectly set near the JR line and 2 other subway lines. The area is also full with restaurants and things to do. The hotel like most in Japan have friendly efficient staff who go out of their way to make your stay as awesome as possible.

I had a 4 night stay at the hotel. Breakfast buffet was good both with Japanese and western food. Rooms was ok, I asked for a non smoking room but when opening the door the smell of tobacco was significant. It was the same all 4 days so the room had been a smoking room for sure.The outdoor pool was closed! Off season they said with 25-28 dgr C outside.

so my first trip ever to japan & stayed at the tokyo dome hotel and it was amazing. fast checkin & super friendly staff ,which most spoke some english and were alway so helpful. great location near tokyo dome, korakuen hall, train / subway station, lots of restaurants, and entertaiment.my room was very nice for me, good size room , nice bed, great views, cable t.v., great wifi, coffee machine, mini bar frig, safe, desk, and a nice bathroom with all the perks. nice big bathtub and free tooth brushes & shaving razors. great maid service and a do not distrub button near the door. morning newpaper included. great price for the area.hotel itself has a bar , multi restaurants, store, taxi stand, snack area, great views!staff was so friendly and helpful my whole stay, from getting me a taxi to helping find the train station to just making sure everything was ok, most of the staff spoke english and that helped alot. very fast checkin and check out.getting from the airport was very easy with the airport limo bus that drops off & picks up right at the hotel for a good price. you can buy a ticket at the bell desk.

We were 7 of us reserved for kaiseki course. Was 6000yen but enjoyed the beauty of Japanese kaiseki as each plate was carefully prepared. Yes small portion as it’s kaiseki but in the end of the course it was full. We ordered additional tempura but it took a bit of time to served. All good experience. They use seasonal materials and we had matsutake in September.

Stayed there 5 days. Convenient location next to metro station. Amazing view from the 34th floor. Spacious and clean room. Friendly staff.Amazing breakfast.Value for money. Everything was great.We would stay there again.Strongly recommended.

Average hotel. Big but too few elevators, expect to spend a lot of time waiting for elevators.Breakfast area is also too small so expect to stand in queue there also. Mainly Japanese focus of the food.Room smelled like smoke but large by Japanese standards.

Here are pro and con in my view.Con:This hotel is right next to the Tokyo Dome which is a home ground of the most popular baseball team in Japan. There is also a stadium for fighting sports such as boxing and wrestling as well as some ad hoc events. So when the big event is happening, everything gets busy from check in, breakfast, elevator, lobby etc.... You might be a bit overwhelmed unless you are part of the crowd for the event. Pro:Though this is a large and busy hotel, hotel staff are still very attentive and pleasant. During my stay of 4 nights, everyone I encountered was always polite, friendly and efficient with smiles. I give a high credit to the customer service manager in this hotel for consistent good service by everyone. The breakfast quality is also very good. Overall, If you are planning to enjoy a baseball game or some events in Tokyo Dome or nearby complex buildings, then this is the best hotel.

Near subway station 5 - 10 minutes walking. Nice room. Good foods . There's so many elevators at the hotel. But not all of them can go through every floor. So we have to queuing a little bit. But overall is good.

Fantastic hotel. Central to all transport with in Tokyo. Shopping mall on site and amusement park.Plenty of food locations also around the hotel. If you like baseball the stadium is overlooked by the hotel. Excellent hotel. Tokyo is fantastic. Japan is amazing.

This was our second visit to the Dome Hotel within the last 6 months. Tried travel sights that offered rooms but found nothing available for my dates. Decided to call directly and was told there's always room for traveling Americans. I would not stay any wheres else in my travels to Tokyo. Great rooms, high floor views, and just great food. I hope that I may be able to stay again in the near future.

Very large and confortable Hotel In Tokyo, compare to most Japanese hotels. It's a very niced designed high rise building, with 1000+ guest rooms and many restaurants! Very convient to everything in the center of Tokyo. I went to a Jaspenses restaurant in the closeby shopping center with friends, which was pretty good too. Very nice view in the everning!
user_name:
Mr_Eastwoods
New York City, New York

review_body: I was fortunate to stay here twice either side of a Princess Cruise to follow the Cherry Blossoms in Japan. The service from the moment my car pulled up at the entrance until I left was exceptional. The rooms were comfortable and beautifully serviced. I ate at the restaurants and found the food and service to be of a very high standard.I can highly recommend this hotel.

This is a very large hotel with many restaurants, services and staff who speak English. Very good breakfast included. A good home base if it’s your first time in Tokyo. Just steps to the subway station. The rooms are quite large but the decor is a bit tired and worn. Very firm mattress.

Good location, good service and facilities. Excellent breakfast and staff.Only drawback was that they did not even have even a half litre bottle of drinking water in the room. They should start providing

Tokyo dome hotel is a high rise 43 storey hotel located near tourist areasTrain station is very close to the hotel the rooms are large and nice I got a view of Tokyo dome and amusement Park the bed is comfortable no free mineral water bottle the buffet breakfast was good staff was superb and helpful

This was my first time staying in Tokyo Dome Hotel, the counter staff upgraded our room to a higher floor for free. We stayed in 32 floors and the nightscape of Tokyo city is amazing! The elevator is fast, quiet and steady. The room is bigger than most of the hotel in downtown Tokyo, of course, the price is higher also. One special element in the room is that there is an internal speaker in the bathroom, you can hear the sound of TV very clearly while you are taking a shower!! This is unique..

We went to visit our nephew before his spring semester exchange in Tokyo ended and this was a good location, just a few subway stops from his dormitory. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, and almost everyone spoke a bit of English. And if they couldn't answer my question, they always found someone who could. The rooms were light and bright, and very comfortable. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable. We added the breakfast option and enjoyed both the Japanese breakfast as well as the Western-style buffet on another floor. But bring your own coffee or pop into the Starbucks on the south side at the corner to grab a box of some of their coffee in a little paper filter you can use in your room. Their coffee was about $3 (300 yen) in a package with a filter that fits over the kit's cup, which isn't really a bad deal if you don't want to bring your own. But there was plenty of oolong and green tea for free. They had a money exchange machine for foreign cash exchange in the lobby that had pretty decent rates. So we were able to get yen from exchanging our Chinese money very easily, and it took many other currencies as well. (The limit was a total of 100,000 yen in exchange) We saw there was a game our first day there and we wished we had time to see the game. Range of Japanese and foreign food restaurants were around and a convenient subway stop right at the corner. We walked to Shibuya and Harajuku so we could just see stuff along the way, about 20 to 30 minutes of walking and most other places were around a half hour on the subway. The Jimbocho used book street isn't far (two subway stops on the Mita line that is outside the hotel) You can get a Pismo subway card in the station (for a 500 yen deposit) and travel on all the different subway lines. There are at least three different companies operating train lines and each require their own tickets if you buy them each time. The Pismo card works on all of them, so it is much more convenient. You just swipe it over the blue lit pad at the gate and go in and swipe to go out to have the fare deducted from the money you put on the card. Rides varied on our trips from about 150 yen to just under 400 yen for longer trips with transfers.The hotel is a stop on an airport bus line from both Tokyo airports so it was easy to get there and back to the airport. Around 70 minutes at non-rush hour times. The subways don't have lots of escalators, usually only up ones, but lots of stairs, so taking your luggage on the subway and train is a bit of a hassle. Try to find one of the airport buses to take you into town ands back to the airport. If you are trying to save as much money as possible, then the JR train and subways are cheapest. Next time we go to Tokyo, we are going to stay here again, if they aren't booked up. We were very satisfied.

We had an excellent stay in Tokyo Dome in March for four nights. Firstly, the location is excellent, right next to Suidobashi station, which has both subway and JR train links. Shibuya and Shinjuku were both very easily reached via underground (about 10 minutes with one change at Jimbocho). If you plan to use the underground, the unlimited 24 hour pass costs just 900 yen - great value.Our room was on the 28th floor which gave us great views over Tokyo (and the theme park in the grounds of the hotel). The room was clean and spacious and we had a complimentary iPad in the room to help research our time in Tokyo. There is a bar with great views on the top floor.Opposite the reception area is a tourist information desk, which was very useful. It's possible to book a direct bus directly from the hotel to the Mt Fuji area - but book ahead as they sell out quickly.My only complaint about this hotel is that the breakfast options were limited. But there are lots of places to eat nearby, including Japanese restaurants, cafés, a Starbucks and of course the all-important 7Eleven.

This hotel is conveniently located in the center of Tokyo. The rooms are large and nice. The downside is that when there is a baseball game or a concert at Tokyo Dome, it gets super crowded and you need to queue for check in/out and for elevators. But overall it's a good value hotel. Oh, and the view is great as well.

Hotel entrance large and spacious, staff very helpful. Got us a twin on 32nd floor non smoking. Again the room just felt prefect, not huge not small just right. Amazingly clean and the bathroom was everything you want, heated look seats as normal. Bath filled in 2 mins. Hairdryer that could dry hair.They supply smart phone/hotspot in the room you can use all over japan. it will give you 30mins hotspot free then just Y300 per day. Cheaper than a sim.Work desk looked out a great window onto the city. Position is great for public transport with limo couches to both international airports.Lifts we fast and no issue on checkout. Pre check out at desk night before no issue.There is a great buffet there but we had just been to other places and were over buffet for a while. Great Express Coffee shop just opposite the tube station about 4 mins walk, you also walk past a Dennys if that is your thing.Obviously its part for the Dome network and has the stadium and stuff there.TGI Fridays a 2 min walk.If I go to Tokyo again I'm staying here barring an other reason.

Tokyo Dome Hotel is a high-rise 43-storey hotel, overlooking the Tokyo Dome City, with full entertainment, shopping and an amusement park.This hotel has a huge lobby and seating area. Christmas decorations have already been put up while we were there in November, with a huge Christmas tree, beautifully decorated at the foyer. We were quickly attended by female concierges and directed to a systematic queue during check-in. The concierge then escorted us to the room with our luggages. There are 8 lifts serving the hotel guests on different floors. The glass lifts overlook the city view and part of the amusement park.We had a room on the 37th floor with glass window overlooking the amusement park so we can see the roller-coaster and ferris wheel. The room is spacious, clean and comfortable with modern décor. Compared to Tokyo standard, the rooms are of an international standard and are more spacious than the smaller rooms in Tokyo. It is no wonder that Tokyo Dome is a preferred choice for international events as a beauty pageant was being held at the premises and beauty contestants were staying at the hotel. It was a pleasant surprise to see beautiful women in the same lift. Hotel guests couldn't help gawking at the beauty contestants and unabashedly requested for photos to be taken with them.We have two choices of buffet breakfast (an international buffet or a Japanese buffet) which is served at two different restaurants. The international buffet at Rilassa dining room has a wide variety of food but it was even more enjoyable as we were dining with beauty contestants in our midst.As it was the autumn season, we took a 20 minutes walk to Koshikawa Korakuen Garden from the hotel, to view the beautiful autumn foliage. It is great that a park is located near to the hotel.There are plenty of shops, restaurants and cafes at LaQua mall and Tokyo Dome City, which are within 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. Besides the amusement park which has a high-tension "Thunder Dolphin" roller coaster, ferris wheel, merry-go-round, Viking, Drop Tower, baseball fans also have a specialty shop as baseball games are often held at Tokyo Dome City.In the evening, lights lit up the Tokyo Dome City area, little garden with autumn trees, the fountain area and surrounding buildings and it was a beautiful sight to behold.Tokyo Dome Hotel has plenty of exciting and fun activities to offer so there are always plenty of things for us to do during our short stay. We would recommend this hotel for its warm hospitality and close proximity to amenities and full entertainment.

Stayed five nights as part of a tour group; wonderful stay for the most part. High end hotel that charges 205 yen (about $2 USD) for each cup of coffee in the hotel room. I thought for such an expensive hotel that coffee should have been free. There was no charge in the room for tea.

11am checkout time, I haven't seen this anywhere else in the world. I travel 250+ days a year. I asked for 12pm checkout, they wanted to charge me $10 per hour. This ISN'T the 1970s! The hotel game is VERY competitive. These jokers are going to be left in the dust with their attitude.The hotel is showing its age these days.And bad location, too far from the action.AVOID

The property is maintained well and very near to suidobashi station which makes commuting easy. The hotel is a treat for travellers and staff is very courteous. You are looking for a lavish stay than this is a right place.Swimming pool is not available in this hotel :( otherwise fantastic.

Sano san was most helpful when he learnt that my dad was sick yesterday evening. Immediately, he made a few phone calls and got us to an English speaking doctor near Tokyo main station before it closed. As it was only 45mins to the clinic’s closing time, he facilitated our journey there by taxi by telling the taxi driver the building’s location and also informing the driver to hurry us there before the clinic closed. When we returned to the hotel, he was at the lobby to check on us. The next morning, he was there again to check if my dad was feeling better. I am totally impressed by his sincerity and warmness - if I come back to Tokyo for the vacation, this hotel where I’ll staying. Rooms are roomy for Tokyo standard and location is excellent. A round of applause for Sano san!

The hotel is with good location which is near the subway station, shopping areas and restaurants. The staff were very helpful and spoke English well. The room is very clean and comfortable, although the beds are a bit hard. And the price is acceptable.

Decent hotel with smaller, NYC sized rooms. Great water pressure, kettle for tea, humidifier and decent toiletries. Scale in room and very comfortable lighting options. Good view of nearby attractions. Only complaint is faint smell of cigarettes in pillows.

For Japan, the room and bathroom is quite spacious. There is a writing desk and armchair. I got a view of the Tokyo Dome and amusement park. The bed is comfortable but pillows were hard/synthetic. There was no free bottled water. I boiled the tap water in the provided hot pot before drinking. There are no toiletries in the bathroom, everything was from re-fillable containers stuck onto the wall, which I suppose is more environmentally friendly. The buffet breakfast was OK, nothing great but the basics were available. Check-in and check-out was smooth and quick as thankfully there were no groups around. However, there are queues for the lifts at certain times. If you need to be in this part of Tokyo, then it is a reasonable choice.

A large hotel located right next to the Tokyo Dome. Due to the proximity of the Dome, it is also very close to multiple train / subway lines. [Chuo Line, Chuo-Sobu Line, Mita Line, Marunouchi Line, Nanboku Line to name a few]We were here for the Taylor Swift concert and the hotel was ready to deal with the huge wave of visitors. They had enough staff to deal with the surge.Lots of underground parking at a reasonable price if you are staying at the hotel. It has in / out privileges. As for the room, it was a reasonable size. Nice bed and they had branded toiletries. Nothing extremely posh but everything was clean and comfortable. Free newspaper delivered to your door in the morning.There are multiple restaurants in the building. There is a wedding chapel, banquet rooms and conference rooms.This is a large hotel complex that has worked out the kinks and the stay was very comfortable. Reasonably priced mid range hotel.We would consider this place again.

Loved this hotel for the start to the finish of the stay. Easy check in and easy checkout using the automated system. The rooms were clean and of a decent size, providing an amazing view of the dome and the amusement park at night. Even the elevators were nice and quick.Access to the metro and trains were close. Providing easy access to Shibuya, shinjuku on one side and akihabara on the other just a few stops away. The area around the hotel was clean with many restaurants and shops close by.

Tokyo Dome Hotel is conveniently located in a very strategic place with both subway and JR Stations just a stone throw away. Convenience store like 7-eleven is very near as well as one of the famous place to get your Japan Souvenirs, Don Quijote is within walking distance. The rooms and bathrooms are very spacious and clean. Unfortunately i was assigned a smoking room, and having a sensitive nose, and being a non-smoker I could really tell it was a smoking room as smoking smell residue is present in the room. The receptionists gave their very best to find me another room but unfortunately since an event is being held, all rooms are occupied. You should try their Japanese breakfast, it is way much better than the buffet. The staff in the Japanese breakfast place were awesome. Specially the senior guy who greets you by the entrance, and the lady waitress who speaks fluent English. They are so hospitable that I want to eat there everyday. Unfortunately I was not able to get their names :(Rooms with even number have a view of Tokyo Tower while odd number rooms have views of the Dome and Amusement Park.
user_name:
Dipsoul
Quezon City, Quezon City, Philippines

review_body: A busy hotel which is nicely located out of the hustle and bustle, good eateries located nearby. We requested a non-smoking room, upon checkin and shown to our room it was obvious someone e had been smoking. Went back down to reception, offered a room with two beds, no, abut more keyboard work and they put ya on the non-smoking floor, this was the only hiccup and it was sorted in adequate time. Water is good to drink, they are very proud if their water in Tokyo. Metro close to get to the busy sightseeing and everyone is mists helpful.

I've only spent a night in this hotel but i love the view of the city and i would walk around at night to look for good Japanese food. You would be able to find a few small shops that sells BBQ / grill fish and they serve good sake or beer if you don't fancy sake. There is even a convenient store / shop like that opens till late night. You'll be amazed by the stuff they sell there. Well about the rooms, they are not too small, basic amenities provided. Breakfast has more varieties and food is good. Many types of beverages provided.

This hotel is located next to the Tokyo Dome where the Giants Baseball team plays. This is a older hotel, but very clean and a big hotel. The rooms are comparable to American sizes. The staff are helpful and friendly and they speak English. The hotel is close to the train station and a lot of stores and restaurants. My stay was pleasant and would stay again!

This has to be one of the best Hotel in Tokyo. My wife and myself looked for a central location and decided on the Tokyo Dome Hotel. Everyone was gracious on our arrival and assisted us in getting settled and advising where to travel locally and where the trains were located. Breakfast buffet in outstanding. Our room on the 35 floor gave us an outstanding view of Tokyo. Even with the impending typhoon, we felt secure and safe within this facility. We were so impressed that we plan a return trip in April and my wife says that it will have to be at the Tokyo Dome Hotel.

After spending 10 days at some dodgy hotels around Japan it was great to arrive there. Modern lobby and very good large rooms with great views. Breakfast was very busy. Only problem was the foot massage I got was more of a leg rub!

This is a nice BIG hotel with surprisingly big rooms (well, at least compared to what you usually expect in Japan). Not the most fancy district, but centrally located, easy to reach and with a great view.

Great Hotel centrally located within all of the tourist areas by train. Train station very close to the hotel. Staff was superb and very courteous. Breakfast buffet was very good. Look forward to it every morning. Don’t make the same mistake I did, as I rented a pocket wife so I would have internet connection for google maps. Use the free phone they give you and save your money. Wish I did.

This is OK hotel for business, but nothing more.As others note, this is largely a leisure hotel with a large number of guests in the thousand-plus rooms coming or going to an event at the same time. The queues can get long. But if you aren't here during a tourist-drawing event, you're fine (note the stadium Dome is next door along with a theme park). When I arrived, I was ushered to the premium/elite line. The regular check-in line appeared to be a 30-40 minute wait. Had I been in that line, I would have cancelled my reservation and walked out. The hotel has responded to similar complaints here simply that they are "busy". There are a lot of thousand-plus room hotels in the world that manage a check-in queue without such waits. Same for the elevators, which can be aggravating at times. Even more frustrating is that you can see a whole other bank of elevators on the other side of the hotel that aren't even in use for guests. The hotel could fix the queue problem, but chooses not to.The room is basic. Reasonably clean, but with stains on the bathroom tiles and marks on the walls. My "non-smoking" room smelled (a little bit) of smoke. I could easily hear noise from the park in my room.Room is small, but normal for Japan.A/c worked like a champ, though. As did the wifi.Plenty of restaurants around, but most are overpriced and poor quality. The breakfast buffet, to me as an American, was devoid of appetizing options. I ate cold fried potatoes my first morning here. Worse - it seems the buffet was recently closed by the Japanese health authorities due to a food poisoning event (as per a letter in my room that it reopened on the day of my arrival). This was the first time in my life I was glad to have a Starbucks nearby.If you're here for business and can walk from the hotel, this is still a convenient / ok option. For all other visits, I advise you book elsewhere.

We checked into the hotel on the 14th of sept this few days ago and most dissapointed with the facilities. First of all for everyone who wishes to book this place because it mentions shinjuku as its location (on agoda the site where we booked the hotel). It is not shinjuku, its Korakuen, which is one hour walking from Shinjuku station and 20 mins by cab. So pretty misleading. Second, we paid almost 20000 yen per night and unlike all hotels we stayed in Japan they didnt provide any complimentary packaged mineral water in the room. They are charging 205 japanese yen for a 500 ml of water. Astonishing. When asked why her explanation was it is because we can drink water from the tap. Iron/Iron board too is not there in the room. They provide you one depending on availability. Staff might be courteous but the facilities they provide in comparision to the room charge and location makes it not worth it at all.

Great service, walking distance to everything and overlooking the Tokyo Dome! We walked 5 minutes to watch the Tokyo Giants Play the Hiroshima Carps. Unfortunately the Giants were beaten in the last innings, thrilling game and so easy to get out. The security had the patrons moving quickly and fluidly through the swing doors. Everyone was so polite. Loved it.

Arrived late at night in Tokyo after long flight from Sydney via Hong Kong. The tour guide [ Kelly ] met us at the airport and arranged for an taxi to take us to the hotel. This was great as we learnt on the tour there is a lack of English being spoken by the Japanese people. She also gave us the hotels arrival advise welcome to Japan detailing our room number and other important information. Most important her mobile phone number. Not all hotels on . the tour did this,

Its roomy and comfortable. The service also good . The location is near Suidobashi station. It's easy to find shopping center and food court just by walk. The city scenery around the hotel also impressive.

We went to Japan with Travel Group. We are very lucky to get the opportunity to stay here.Room is very big and our room was facing the Tokyo Dome. Knowing A list celebrities performed here amazed us. It is really big.Hotel is very clean and modern.And have all those Japanese tech.Highly recommended.

When you enter this hotel , it gives you a very grand feel . You almost feel important in this overwhelming city and that feels good . The room itself is small but nothing uncomfortable and that is a standard expected in Japan. Breakfast was good and the location was great. Because of Tokyo dome city, the area was happening and full of life all hours of the day. The train station was next door and it was easy to get anywhere. The staff was helpful and polite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in a luxury place.

Nice comfy rooms, next to the dome, eatery , restaurants , pubs you name it they have it. Now if you need to get Giant souvenirs there is a shop right outside the hotel. They also have Giant Hello Kitty , so cute...got one for my daughter.

This hotel caters to tourists and it is next to the Dome where the Giants play. The elevators can be crowded and the lobby very busy. We stayed nine days and on both Saturdays the check in line rivaled the TSA line, it looked to be an hour wait or better. We didn’t try the buffet breakfast as it is big and crowded. There is a Starbucks next door and many other choices such as Tully’s. The rooms are very clean but could quieter. The staff is very attentive and gave us umbrellas to use and you can also ride the limousine bus directly to either airport from the lobby as well as buy tickets. The AC worked very well as we visited during 100 degree weather and it was comfortable in the room.

My First Two Night at 8th Floor, My 3rd Night at 39th Excellency Floor Suite Room. My Experience at both type of room is very good, and also price for the quality in term of room size and, check in chwck out procedure so fast, even at midnight they have standing employee who help you,. Minus for this hotel just for the saving in energy/electricty make you must wait for another 10 minutes at night if its crowded especially if you stay above 23th floor, I think they should evaluate their policy not on time basis, but on flexible room occupancy basis.

This hotel is a perfect example of, how a hotel should be operated. My family stayed in this superb hotel for two nites and what an experienced we had. Facilities are excellent, superb breakfast, excellent staff. Views from high floor rooms ? Magnificent! Next trip to Tokyo, for sure, Tokyo Dome Hotel is on my top priority list.

I stay there last week with my family..the staffs are very helpful..the room's fine and you won't be afraid about your needs..a lot of restaurants, mall, and convenient store are around..the amusement park us quite Good also, try the roller coaster it Will blow your adrenaline

Travel company in India booked us in this hotel during our stay in Tokyo. We were doubtful how this hotel could be till we entered. But when we stepped out of taxi and entered into lobby all doubts got vanished. Entrance lobby is very grand and the reception counter is large enough to give service to many guests at a time as quick as possible. Receiving staff for guest was very much cordial and guest friendly. With this one become at ease. Bags, luggage etc are handled quickly. Also room allocation, showing directions of rooms, information about hotel is given in no time and in efficient way. Hotel is having 35+ floor and many rooms. Size of rooms are good enough to have space around bed and room is complete with furniture and spacious. If breakfast is included, then restaurant is very nice with multiple choices for different type of guests coming from different countries. Staff who is attending concerious desks are also very helpful and give the right information. As per hotel policy, they do not provide drinking water bottles hence you have to arrange by self. Also tea kettle with bags are given but without sugar and cream hence one may have to do needful. Overall good, centrally located, can be approached by Metro. There are restaurants inside and also nearby. So also amusement park at side is available. Nice hotel to try if you are in Tokyo.

The hotel offers convenient location, near the subway station, shopping areas, reataurant, friendly and helpful hotel staff. The rooms are just the right size with clean toilet. Price is not so expensive.

My stay here for a day was great. The staff were very helpful and spoke English well. The hotel provides Wi-Fi service. The bed was comfortable and the room was quite spacious. It has a great location too since it’s quite easy to access restaurants, minimarkets, etc.

1. I was allocated a smoking family room when none of us are smokers. 2. The hotel is stuck in the 80s. NOTHING has been updated. There are separate hot/cold taps and you're caught burning or freezing trying to adjust it right. Terrible especially with young ones. 3. The tokyo dome city looks great in pics. It is NOT. The best rides aren't in operation and a viking ride costs 620 yen per pax. 4. I got a room overlooking the city which also meant I overlooked a disgusting algae filled pool. Thankfully I only stayed a night. Went to Hundred Stay for the rest of my stay in Tokyo. Much newer, great location and more convenient to shinjuku.

If you are going to a ball game, stay here! It is perfect! Easy access to the train stations via the subways which are a quick walk! Efficient staff. No 24 hour room service which always makes me sad, as with jetlag I am hungry at all hours.

Had meetings here at the Tokyo Dome Hotel over a couple of days. I was able to explore a lot of the attractions in this complete complex including swimming. Dining and events of all sorts. Great facilities for all purposes. Ample accommodation to stay and enjoy this experience.

When we first arrived I thought that the location was far from everything. After spending several days in Tokyo I realized that there isn't one prime location. It's a massive town and very spread out. The subway is next to the hotel and most everything is just a few stops away. There is a shopping area next to the hotel which has many restaurants to choose from.The hotel is very clean and comfortable, although the beds are a bit hard. The hotel is very large and busy and multiple times the elevator was too crowded to get into which made me late for my tour. The breakfast is plentiful.

best hotel we had visited during our one week stay in Japan amongs all 5other hotels in another province - clean room love it so much - new - bright - great service, n good food, we loved the pumpkin soup, drink three bowl

Tokyo Dome Hotel is one of the best Hotels I have been visited. they have an awesome staff, they are so friendly and eager to serve you with an everlasting smile. rooms are very clean and comfortables, but they have to add english labeling to some of the devices there. taxi reservation and all reception services are more than expected. all my greetings to Tokyo Dome Hotel staff members.

If you were going to rate the hotel on the building design, location, condition, and curb service: this is a 5. But, and this is a big but, there are critical areas that quickly pull the rating back to earth. The language barrier at this hotel is huge--it is not designed for English language visitors. Communicating the most simple issues is almost impossible--can I want to stay in my room after I pay my bill? when will my room be cleaned? where is the bar or restaurant? what are the hours the Imperial Palace gardens are open? do you have a 3 prong plug adaptor (yes, they do)? where will the tour travel agent be in the lobby at 4? Getting these answered is exhausting and frustrating. The restaurants are nice, but not great. The fresh robe everyday is wonderful--a favorite of my wife. The crazy electronic toilet is going to be a story for our grandkids!The rooms are very nice, but even 20+ floors up, there is still audible street noise, the rooms have no night lights (you have to leave the drapes open to have a light to find the bathroom). The TV has no English language stations or news shows. There is no bar open during normal business hours and into the eventing (we have never encountered this situation!) The room cleaning staff is still cleaning occupied rooms at 4 in the afternoon! Finally, the art in the hotel is very small and unimpressive--nothing to catch your eye, but the orchids are beautiful--not big and bold, but very beautiful.This hotel was "picked" for us as a part of our travel package. It did what we needed, but it was tough to deal with the staff for answers to questions. In all our travels, we have never had such a communications issue. We have been far off the beaten path on many trips, but never quite this far!I am not certain we would use this hotel again (which is our minimum standard for a 3), but I am not certain as to our ability to find a better alternative in Tokyo.

Overall good hotel with basic necessities. Spend a night here as I was on tour. Nothing to shout about but location is convenient and near a train station. Will consider to return as a family trip. Breakfast tend to be crowded and the queue is really long. This can be improve further.

I had high hopes for this hotel. It looks impressive from the outside and is even better once you are in the lobby. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful on arrival but after that it was all downhill.The Internet worked intermittently and a manager came up to try to fix it. He confirmed that it only worked in one part of the room, right by the door. He informed me that "I must report it the following day to housekeeping." When I asked why he couldn't do it he replied that he was going off shift and that was it.I am not sure what the system was for operating the lifts but everyday there was a queue on my floor and the lifts were always full or going past my floor. One day over 50 people were queueing and only one lift appeared to be working. When you phoned down to reception you were told you would just have to wait. I persuaded a sympathetic maintenance many to let me and 9 others go down in the service lift.Queues were a theme in this hotel. There was always a queue of 30-50 for breakfast which usually meant a 15-20 minute wait. Yet when you got into the restaurant there were always dozens of empty tables. When asked why we had to wait the managers otherwise good English skills would fail him.The view, the food and the room was good. Management need to do better, much better!

We stayed at this hotel with our Nexus tour. Comfortable room on 17th floor. The only problem was the the room reeked of cigarette smoke, if seemed ingrained in the furnishings. The hotel staff said all rooms were occupied and we couldn’t change as we had at another hotel earlier. Japan seems full of cigarette smokers and is hard to avoid.The buffet breakfast was OK. Cereal was the most difficult to find....coco pops and cornflakes were available. Fruit is expensive in Japan so enjoy it at breakfast. Travel with coffee if you can. The Dome provided plenty of options in the mini bar but only two free teabags. Also your own water bottles as no free water at this hotel unlike all the other hotels we stayed at. Location opposite a railway station, lovely gardens nearby.

I am currently writing this entering my 20th minute waiting for an elevator. 1 is not working and the other 3 each time they stop at our floor are full. Several times the elevator just goes right by. We have a breakfast meeting which we will either be late for or miss entirely.The rooms are fine. The location and property is nice but the infrastructure is so bad that we will not ever stay here again. A complete waste of our time.

Our view over the Dome and Amusements at night was stunning. Our room was of adequate size and was well maintained and clean. The bathroom was good with quick hot water. The wifi worked well. The breakfast catered for a range of people and processed large numbers efficiently. The railway stations were all in easy walking distance. A pleasant stay.

Have stayed in number of hotels in Tokyo and this has to be one property with a decent room size. The view of the city is still stunning and amenities are perfect. Located beside the train station, it is easily accessible to the airport, yet not as busy as other part of Tokyo. The property may be slightly aged, but it is well maintained and for those watching a baseball game at the Tokyo Dome, it is a perfect place to stay.

Considering the location, great breakfast (Japanese or continental), fantastic location (3 subway stations within a 3 min. walk), great views (ask for a high floor room), great choice of 'in house' reastaurants, perfectly clean rooms, great service and reasonable pricing..... LOOK NO FURTHER! The only minor complaint I have is regarding the limited number of English language TV stations. The bed was extremely comfortable and the rooms well insulated from noise. I would highly recommend a deluxe room (much more space than a standard room).

Tokyo Dome Hotel is within walkable distance to JR Station (less than 2 min walk), the airport limosine is available too so a big bonus for convenienceOne JR stop away from Akihabara and 7 stops away from Shinshuku, all non-transfer stop!The room is clean and spacious with excellent viewShower water pressure is greatLots of selections for breakfast buffetA great hotel to stay but maybe pricy too

The hotel staff are EXTREMELY helpful and polite, it was a pleasure to communicate with positive and energetic staff. The restaurants at the hotel are great and breakfast was also fine. There are heaps of restaurants in the local area. There are 2 supermarkets within 200 metres of the hotel if you need snacks Coffee, tea or Milk. The electric jug in the room is brilliant , you can leave it on all day/night to wake up to boiling water for a coffee, just keep it topped up. I recommend buying coffee from the local super market if your staying for a while as it is better than what is provided. The room was big enough but in typical Japanese style it is smaller than western standards. But no complaints at all.We used the Narita shuttle, approx $30 Aust per person each way. About 1:40 minutes journey time.We stayed in 2603 with a nice view of the city and Tokyo Dome fair grounds that shouldn't be missed if you like roller coasters, etc.Will stay here again next year, highly recommended

The Tokyo Dome hotel is one of my preferred hotels I stay at when I am in Japan. You get generously sized rooms which is uncommon in Japan.The employees at the hotel are really friendly and always happy to help out where they can. They have their own restaurants in house so if it is raining and you don't feel like going out, you can choose from several different restaurants.It's next door to the Tokyo Dome stadium which means that getting to and from the hotel is very easy. You can catch the Airport Limousine Shuttle service and it will drop you off at the hotel which is great for people visiting Japan for the first time.The Tokyo Dome has some other good sporting attractions like a place to go indoor bouldering (horizontal rock climbing), practice your golf or baseball swings or explore space with the Japan Space Museum.They have a quaint little amusement park located next door as well so it will keep any smaller kids occupied for about half a day.There are plenty of food choices from traditional Japanese food to Star Bucks and other popular fast food chains.

This is a most excellent hotel. Aged a bit, true, but still top. Rooms are spacious and well provided, except for power outlet, only at the table. Good breakfast, actually with an immense choice for all tastes, unfortunately no nama tamago. Business centre is so so. Location is excellent, by Suidobashi metro and JR station, and Korakuen metro station. A dozen euros by taxi from Ueno station... Service is amazing. Whatever you need they will do it, they will fix it, they will bring it to you. I had a bit of an emergency case and Duty Manager Yutaka Sakai helped me heaps and really saved my day, my week. And as if they were not good and with great food and service, they decide they do not need email. No email address. This is a 21st Century hotel that only uses telephone and fax. Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? I cannot even send a letter to praise Mr Sakai, as there are no more fax machines in the rest of the world.I hope they realise they are shamefully lagging behind and get themselves an email address for correspondence.

Pricy for what you get but a clean, modern hotel with great views. Best, I think, for those who are attending an event at the Tokyo Dome. Otherwise there are many hotels in Tokyo that are a better value.

Pro:- Courteous staff- Fast WIFI- Good Location to stations, shops, restaurants, and entertainmentCon:- Hideous and unhygienic room design- Stingiest 4* I ever have stayed- Mismanaged PropertyTip:Try the wood fired Buffalo Mozzarella Pizza at the Tokyo Mikato restaurant at the ‘Meets Port’ building, 3min walk from the lobby.I’m staying in different 5* to low budget properties all over the world almost every week for business. On this five day trip I stayed at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo (highly recommended, the Tokyo Dome Hotel, and some Quality Inn. The latter is basic but a good consistent no-frills budget hotel.The Tokyo Dome is a design failure and the stingiest property I have experienced anywhere so far:Standard Room Design- No charging facilities near the bed. I was offered a long cord I can trail through the room which I kindly denied. The ‘Premium Room’ however features a multi-plug USB combination charging port next to the bed which can be easily provided in other rooms too.- Carpet in the bathroom!!!! Absolutely unhygienic and a health hazard given the opportunity for mold to grow in a damp environment. Only some ‘Premium rooms’ aka suites have no carpet in the bathroom and I was upgraded to such room after one night after my request.Toiletries- The standard room (I paid USD450 for a two night stay!) only provides Shampoo, Conditioner and a bar of Soap. NO BODY WASH! They are also the cheapest kind available. Only the ‘Premium Room’ comes with body wash as pictured. Stingy as hell!Coffee- ‘Premium Coffee’ is provided in the room at a charge of JPY205. No other even instant Nescafe is provided. Complete rip-off and utmost stingy at USD200+ a night.‘Premium Room’ DesignThe ‘Premium Room’ features a remote controlled ceiling light (pictured) operating independently from the master room light switch. The remote is entirely in Japanese and there is no information that it belongs to such light.The room layout and fittings of the ‘Premium Room’ seem to be thrown together with whatever they found. No design thought, taste, nor quality has gone into designing the room. Judge for yourself, pictures included in review. Especially the dirt ridden waste basket from the dollar shop is a turn off.MismanagementI was awoken by drilling and vibrations on the morning of my second stay. Usually hotels provide advance or in-room notification of refurbishment works. Hotel Management had no knowledge and only after a ten minutes they found out that there was work on the 34th floor, I stayed at the 36th floor. The 35th floor was also occupied. Usually hotels would at least vacate one floor below and above of any floor being renovated and provide notices. Unacceptable.Still awaiting my second night refund which should be credited through Expedia according to the hotel.

Great location next to the Tokyo Dome City which is a new happening venue especially for the youngsters. The hotel is new, clean and very spacious for a prime location in the centre of Tokyo! We stayed there before the Christmas and the place was beautifully decorated with colourful lightings, creating a joyous festive mood!

Good location – handy to the Subway across the road. Plenty of places to eat – provided there are no big shows on at the Dome. On the downside, the hotel looked tired and well worn. The Breakfast was always a queue – bit it moved surprisingly fast with a large volume of people moving through. Great variety of food on offer and the tables were not too crammed in. The lifts are an issue – allow an extra few minutes while they pre-warn you of their impending arrival – but simply not arrive for an extraordinary time. The tower is split in two with 3 lifts servicing the lower floors and 3 servicing the upper floors but still take an age. We did have some communication issues with several of the staff. A 'cuppa' at the end of the day proved to be an issue. The tea provided was not good - and no milk is available, no matter how hard you try to communicate to the staff at any of the Restaurants.

Right in the centre of Tokyo dome city with train station across the road. Beautiful green areas, rides and lots of restaurants nearby. Very nice rooms, great breakfast and free wifi. Would recommend this hotel.

We stayed at Tokyo dome hotel on Sept27 , that was my first time to stay in the downtown of Tokyo .so good location and service . Many places and shopping area around the hotel . Highly recommended .If you come to Tokyo , you may choose it .

Upside Big hotel Well connected to the subway system ( soadabashi & Koraken) Downside Old furnishings Stale smell in corridors Breakfast spread is big but quality is average Went for a conference at the hotel staying there made most sense However the staff is overworked The Hotel needs a makeover it's past it's prime Though views from the above floors are really good The Roof top restaurant has staff which can't communicate in English properly which is slightly surprising ( explaining the menu is difficult for them ) Nice and helpful people all around though Also has a Japanese park to walk around

We had a 4 night stay in November and at that time the Ms International delegates were booked there and attending to some pre-pageant activities.This hotel has a great location as the Tokyo dome City is adjacent to the hotel. nearby is an amusement park for kids and the Tokyo Dome, the place to watch big concerts, shows, baseball can be seen from your hotel window! The subway stations are also close by. The hotel is also located in a relatively quiet section of Tokyo.Rooms are spacious for Tokyo standards. It has the usual amenities so you do not have to worry if you left your shampoo or toothbrush at home. Internet is fast but occasionally slows down.breakfast options are Japanese and Western.If you want gym facilities you have to go to Tokyo Dome city for the Spa and you have to pay for this.So, I would jog around the Tokyo Dome and Dome city for the exercise.This hotel is great when shopping and entertainment activities are a must!

Batangas City, Batangas City, Philippines

review_body: This hotel is comfortable, but worn. I have been staying here twice a year (at least) for the last 7 or so years, sometimes for over a week at a time. They don’t seem to keep records of their frequent guests which is a shame. I went down this morning to ask for an extra hour in my room until the airport bus departure time. They wanted to charge me about $10 for the privilege. As someone who spends many many nights here, it struck me as very petty and poor reward for my years of loyalty. I will say that the rooms are larger than most Japanese hotel rooms which is wonderful.

Great views of the Tokyo Dome and the theme park as part of the Tokyo Dome City precinct. The rooms were very spacious for Japanese hotels, very clean and modern. The hotel buffet breakfast was enjoyable, with so many options. A fun location with so much to do and see walking distance to Akihabara. The hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful, even made dinner reservations for us at a restaurant in Shinjuku as we couldn’t speak Japanese to make a reservation. A bit expensive but worth it for a few days for a special occasion or experience.

We came here on a group tour so we had no say in the booking. However we were greatly pleased with this hotel. The rooms were very spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. In fact we had our best sleep in Japan here. As per usual there was no English speaking channel on the television but by some miracle we found a movie that they'd forgotten to dub. Breakfast was pretty ordinary but all in all we were extremely happy here. Also the location was pretty good as it was next to their big fairground and to a railway station.

It is a big hotel and there are a lot of tour groups staying here. The breakfast (buffet) does not really have many varieties but it fills you up. The sushi restaurant on site is extremely expensive and portions really small (even with sushi standard). The area is nice with lots of young people in cosplay costumes taking photos. Amazing how nice they all looked. There is a tiny garden within walking distances that's ok. I have seen many better ones around the world. Check in and out was fast.

Nice open spacious lobby. Good size room with desk and 2 desk chairs and a full size chair. Good size bathroom. Has room safe. Free wi-fi in room. Buffet breakfast has several Asian and western food selections, egg cooking station, fruit. As usual, very runny eggs.We had very little need for interaction with the staff so can't comment on service.Tokyo Dome complex is right behind hotel and a nice area.I think this was our favorite among 5 hotel stays in Japan on this trip.
