review_body: I planned a tour through Tokyo Dome Hotel. I was told the departure time was 7.50. I arrived and was told it was 8.30. So I went and had a coffee and then was told when I returned the bus left at 7.50. The man who told me blatantly lies and said he never told me that. Dishonest and terrible service. They didn't even attempt to resolve my issue they just basically suggested it was my fault.

Tokyo Dome Hotel is in a quiet prefecture that seems to be more for the locals. The hotel seemed to be full of Japanese tourists, which we enjoyed. Although it is a big hotel, it was still peaceful and the room we had, overlooking the city on the 26th floor, was lovely and definitely big for Japanese standards. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so I can't comment on that. However, I would definitely recommend going to the sky lounge on the 47th floor for a drink or just to look at the view from up above. If you have kids, it's also located next to a small amusement park. And with regards to transport, there is a subway right next to the hotel and a JR line not much further.

Tokyo Dome Hotel is really nice Hotel and the Staffs are very friendly and speak very good English. There is a stadium at the back of the hotel. Plenty of restaurants to eat and very close to subway train station and Shopping Centre and a lots of entertainment for the kids.

This is a really nice hotel: clean and the staff were very helpful. Rooms are well presented and roomy. There is plenty of choice for restaurants within the complex and loads of eateries not far from the hotel. Although not central, it's a good location for Tokyo sightseeing.

Although, I enjoyed my stay in Japan, however, the hotel Limo service was really impacts on the customer satisfactionI paid the service noon time, they registered under 95, 94 and 93They collected my luggage, before embarking the bus, they stopped us, when we checked the recipient portions were with them They forced us to pay again as I paid againThe lady was delivering the services with sense of funWe were family stayed rooms 1318 and 1322I will take this experience and disseminate to all my customers and friends Very bad customer serviceI am working in travel tourism Yusuf Husainme_zasht@yahoo.com

Booked this hotel for 2 nights. Ask by booking for non-smoking room. By arrival they told me there is no non-smoking room available anymore. Boy by reception told we will spray in the room and then will be ok. They gave me room on 9th floor, in the hall already many smoke. In room even more, I woke up with a heavy headache. Next day I ask again for a non-smoking room, took a long time but they give. On departure day I ask for late check out, my flight is at 11pm. Reception told me that I have to checkout before 11:30am. There is no room available. I told her that I want to pay for late check-out. She walked away and come back with manager. Manager told that I have to pay fully day rate extra if I want to have a late check out. Strange first no room available but if you pay day rate extra they have a room. Decide to check out early and book a cheaper hotel closer to the airport.

I stayed at this hotel for one night and was surprised the convenient location, and direct airport bus service to/from Haneda airport. Clean room, fast internet and good breakfast buffet. Subway station is right next to the hotel makes it easy to get around the city.

Love this hotel for the great location near JR station and many restaurants, coffe shops and attractions around Tokyo Dome. I have visited Tokyo twice and chose staying at Tokyo Dome Hotel last year 2016 and this July 2017

LOCATION A++! This hotel's best quality is the location. It is perfect for kids and adults. Right outside the hotel are 2 metro lines that easily connect you to Shibuya, Akihabara, Shinjuku, etc. Also right outside the hotel is a nice park and a small theme park with a ferris wheel and other fun rides. Plenty of restaurants to choose from including both local Japanese and international brands like TGI Friday's. The view from our 16th floor window was spectacular. The staff was excellent, friendly and very helpful. They provided power adapters, advice, etc quickly and politely. My family of 3 stayed for 2 nights on July 3rd and 4th, 2017. We had a "3 bed room" that was really 2 beds a pull out sofa. All in all, it was very nice. First, rooms in Tokyo are almost always really small. This was my 6th hotel in Tokyo and the room was the most spacious. The bathtub was great and easily deep enough to nearly submerge myself (I'm 5'11"). If your in Tokyo for holiday and want a "big" hotel, this is a great pick!

The hotel is centrally located. Walking distance next to JR Station very easy access. The check in was fast and excellent helpful front desk staff. The room assigned 3103 had a marvelous view of the Tokyo Dome and its surroundings. The room itself is not a luxury one more looks like a new Holiday Inn but very clean and nice size for Tokyo standards rooms. Normal hotel size bathroom with excellent cold and hot water pressure and toiletries including toothbrush and shaving razors among others. Safe deposit box in room. All the staff is great very customer service oriented. The breakfast buffet fell short in quality and quantity you can skip to buy the breakfast with your stay. We stayed for 4 nights and the breakfast was the same every day with no change. The selection and the quality of food wasn't 4/5 star I rated 2. The hotel is annexed to the Tokyo Dome we had the chance to enter a baseball game for free. People line up and baseball teams give away free tickets and goodies excellent for souvenirs. The hotel is very clean and offers excellent service. The concierge always working and offers great help and detailed info for any need. Just downstairs the Hotel are a food court and a lot of restaurants bars and pubs. Also a amusement park and a lot of places for small children's and teenagers. Very safe and convenience location. If you traveling as a family I strongly suggest this Hotel you will enjoy your stay and a lot to do around if you don't feel to take a cab or train. Check out was fast and accurate. They offer airport shuttle for around $30.00 per person and they storage your belongings for free until your departure. The hotel itself has several bars and restaurants that I reviewed check my other reviews. If you have any question just ask Ill try my best to answer it!!If you feel my review was helpful please click below, it is free makes me happy and going ..!! Enjoy your trip!

Stayed at Tokyo Dome for one night. Rooms were spacious, considering the average size of rooms in Tokyo. Bathrooms were huge too. My favorite part is their location, which is only a walking distance to the nearest train station. Breakfast was good, loaded with variety of foods. Staff was friendly and definitely will stay here again. Best hotel during my trip to Japan!

Very nice stay at the hotel. It has an amazing view. We stayed at 35th floor and the view from Tokyo Dome city (roller coaster, Tokyo Dome stadium and buildings) were amazing. Specially at night when they illuminate everything with different colours).The pool was really nice (the only thing is that it you have to pay extra for it).I would definitely stay here again in Tokyo if I have the money. Other thing to notice is that Check in and check out are really fast, comparing to other hotels that they ask you a lot of stuff. That was great. Personnel was really kind!

Stayed 1 night while transit to Yokohama. The hotel is modern and centrally located. A lot of restaurants and shops nearby and the underground is next to it! The hotel room is spacious and clean. However, we were arranged on a smoking floor! Nightmare! The hotel staff claimed there's a spray inside the closet which would eliminate the smell of the smoke . No choice! It did work quite well ! However, I was woken up all night long because of the terrible smoking smell penetrated deep inside the blanket!!!The buffet breakfast was average in Same class Japanese hotel ! Definitely no more staying in this hotel because of the smell of smoke!

I stayed in the hotel for two nights and enjoyed the convenience of the hotel location. Transport was really convenient with JR and subway close by. It is also very nice to be located as part of the Tokyo Dome city, where there are plenty of restaurants, some shops at LaQua and also amusement rides like the hyper roller coaster, water slide and ferries wheel. There are also bowling and roller skate parks around, and certainly the place to stay if you are here for baseball matches. It is easy to spend a day just at the city. The Korakuen Japanese garden is also just next door for an easy stroll. The hotel room is spacious and comfortable, although it is not the latest in decor or technology given that it is not a newly built hotel, it is a well kept hotel that is well located. I also appreciate that the airport limo stops at the entrance of the hotel, and hotel staff are really helpful in arranging for the airport limo transfer.

My son who plays college baseball and I decided to go to Tokyo to see a three game series between the Tokyo Giants and the Yakult Sparrows. What better place to stay at than the Tokyo Dome Hotel? The Hotel was very modern with a nice lobby. Very easy to get to from Narita airport and I'd assume probably from Haneda as well. As soon as we walked out of the terminal at Narita we hopped on a scheduled bus service (about $30) which stopped at the Tokyo Dome Hotel. I believe it was the 3 stop. Check in was easy. No lines. One of the best things about this hotel is the staff. There were probably 10 people working check ins. So while there were quite a few people checking in there was no wait. Also every time you walk in or out the front door there are staff people waiting to help you. There are usually two people sitting at the Concierge desk. We used then daily with questions about transportation, sights, dining options etc. They were extremely helpful. The rooms were nice. Beds firm, but very comfortable. I would suggest getting a room as high up as possible since the views of Tokyo are outstanding. Only thing about the room is that they don't have 3 hole electrical outlets like the ones that you'd need to charge your laptop. This wasn't a problem though. I asked at the front desk and a guy with an adapter showed up at our room in about 10 minutes. Overall outstanding hotel, especially if you're there to see an event or game at the Tokyo Dome.I only had one problem. Tokyo in July is very hot and humid. We would usually get back to the hotel at about 4:00 PM in order to go to the games at 6:00. For some reason the pool is not open on weekdays!! It would have been very nice to be able to cool off by the pool for an hour or two before going back out that night. Instead we had to just go back to the room and shower off.

We spent 6 nights in this monstrosity of a hotel. The rooms were well kept and comfortable, the bathroom has a bath with a shower in it which is the only reason it give it a 4 and not a 5 rating. The breakfast buffet offers a wide variety of foods and everything is deliciously fresh! There are many restaurants and a lot to do around the hotel precinct. The train stations are close to the hotel and easily accesible. I will definitely stay in this hotel again on future trips to Tokyo!

We stayed at the Tokyo Dome Hotel for five nights during a recent visit to Tokyo. The hotel is located very close to the Suidobashi Station (a Mita line stop) and not too far from the Iidabashi Station. The Tokyo Dome is, of course, also nearby, and the Imperial Palace is a 20- to 30-minute walk from the hotel. If you're craving Western food, there's a Subway restaurant across the street, and a McDonald's nearby, as well. Our room was clean and the staff was friendly. Visitors should be aware, however, that they charge approximately $15 USD to use the pool, and that you cannot swim in the pool if you are tattooed (this isn't uncommon in Japan).

We are two couples arriving at 6.30am from Australia after an all night flight to find rooms would not be available until 2pm! Nowhere to freshen up or even get a cup of coffee. Staff unhelpful. Don't book here without confirming your check in time!

Very good location, near main places in town, for office, shopping, and train, subway access. Also, there is a baggage storage service for checking out and returning to get your baggage or if you are going to other places in Japan, but will be back, and can leave your bigger suit case. Currier service (tākubin) on the reception floor. Room has mini bar, tv, comfortable bed and locker, bathroom has a drier and a nice Japanese toilet seat with washing options.

To me this hotel was just fine. Room was large for Tokyo standards and right next to convenient shopping mall with many restaurants.Breakfast buffet was plentiful and at the times we went there was no queue.Service was polite and efficient.The bar was pricey but lovely view.All in all a great stay and happy to recommend!

This was our very first night in Japan. Having been told that hotel rooms are very small we were prepared for the worst. Tokyo Dome was a pleasant surprise as the rooms were rather large. Good fittings and furniture also. There was a long queue for breakfast even though there were tables vacant. They need to manage their service better ie faster. The hotel is well located and all in all this was a great start to our Japan trip.

Stayed at Tokyo Dome Hotel as part of a package tour, but the location was really good as it was a easy 5 mins walk to the nearest JR station. My room has a beautiful view of the dome and the mini theme park. I didn't visit the theme park, but the shopping mall was decent size with lots to see. Love that there is a supermarket nearby with lots of restaurants. Breakfast was alright, with a decent selection. My only complaint is that there isn't even free bottled water or instant coffee provided as part of the hotel stay. Or at least provide me with a teaspoon so i can stir my own coffee.

We watched Coldplay at the Tokyo Dome on April19,2017, so this was the perfect hotel since it's a 2-3min walk to the concert venue. Other than that, the hotel has nice spacious rooms, big in size actually, considering Japan room standards. And we were lucky we got a great view of the Tokyo Dome. Wonderful view day & nite. Just outside the hotel there is a Starbucks & a 24hr convenience store. There are cafes, shops, a game arcade, and many restos around the area too. 5mins walk to the JR station and the Tokyo Metro. A bonus was that Cherry Blossom trees lined up the promenade. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely come back too.
user_name:
ChristineB441
Quezon City, Quezon City, Philippines

review_body: In Tokyo to catch a concert at the Dome, we chose the hotel because of its location. Effortless transport to the hotel as there was a direct airport limousine bus from Narita that took us straight to the hotel. Hotel guests were given discount coupons to the various attractions around the Dome. Our room had a beautiful view of the dome and the theme park. One night at the hotel is not enough, there is so much to do and explore.The hotel breakfast is awesome with a huge selection. Due to the size of the hotel and the many rooms, you can expect a crowd and it does get very busy. Service standards are not compromised and you will still have an enjoyable experience.Definitely one of my favourite hotels in Tokyo. Will be back.

Stayed at Tokyo Dome Hotel for 4 nights while on vacation. Location was excellent with an easy walk with luggage from the nearest JR station. Lots of food options available at an easy walk & a Lawson's foodmart & 7/11 close by. Rooms were very quiet and our non-smoking room definitely smelt clean, though I did detect the odour in a neighbouring room that the clearners were airing. Only complaint is that the beds were very hard.

Great for families with children. The Tokyo dome area is like a mini resort with lots of things for children to do. It is also near the JR line with close proximity to a lot of tourist area, such as Shinjuku and Akihabara, and major shines.Hotel is the standard fare, nothing bad or spectacular.

I have just checked out of the hotel yesterday.The location is satisfactory, being next to mass transit stations.However, there is not much eateries around when compared with the Shinjuku area.The room itself is great, being spacious for a double room (33 Sq. m.) by Japan standard. However, the air-conditioning is not satisfactory. We tried the lower temperature and maximal wind speed but only a trace of airflow could be detected from the air vent. The window could not be opened so the room was stuffy.Another pitfall is the lack of complimentary bottled water or coffee in the room. The only free item in the room were too packs of teabags.Nevertheless the price is reasonable for such a spacious room so it has earned some points on that.Richard Lau

I stayed here in June for about 5 days and i fell in love with this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The cleaners also provided extra coffee for my room because the mugs was not washed properly. Location wise, there is a train station about 10min walk from the hotel and next to the hotel there is already a shopping mall with many shop. There was also an amusement park next to the hotel but in the room, you won't be able to hear people screams and shouts.Will definitely come back

This hotel is right beside the impressive Tokyo Dome and part of the Tokyo Dome City. You can take a limousine bus from Narita airport straight to the hotel and it takes about close to two hours. There's a food court nearby and some shops. You never feel the crowds are very overwhelming in this area of Bunkyo, unlike say Shibuya.First thing that we noticed was the huge lobby. Very busy with throngs of tourists and visitors but you never really feel that it is overcrowded because of the vastness of the lobby. Staff were very professional and proficient in English.The elevators at the side of the hotel gave great views of the surrounding areas at high levels. We managed to snag a 35th level room and the views were spectacular! The rooms are not modern by any means but they are huge by Tokyo standards. Ample space to walk around and there's even a coffee table by the window where you can enjoy tea or coffee and just take in the views. Really liked the large wardrobe too. The bathroom was also very spacious! Carpeted area near the sink and big bathtub. Really no complaints here.The Wifi was also quite adequate. Did not try any of the restaurants here so cannot comment.Will definitely consider staying here again.

Having small and simple rooms are quite common to hotels located in the heart of the city. Their market is just different to hotels that is not really accessible and for Tokyo Dome Hotel, it's the view that made them quite popular in Tokyo aside from the fact that's literally beside the Tokyo Dome Stadium and that glass elevator adds a nice touch.Breakfast has a lot of choices, there are some stand outs in their hot dishes but the pastries were just okay, nothing significant. Overall, this hotel is good for people who's on a business trip and for families that's on vacation.

This is a $300 + a night hotel, and booked it upon arrival at the airport at booking.com and got it for 1/2 price. Beautiful, modern, Christmas time and had giant Christmas tree in lobby.Staff and service, typical Japanese efficiency and professionalism.had a room at about the 30th floor and night view was amazing.Its really a complex called Tokyo Dome City, Hotel, The Dome Stadium and restaurants and other facilities. Convenient when you arrive late in the afternoon, just go outside in the complex and there are restaurants and bars right there, next to the hotel, its like an outside mall.large rooms, clean, amenities, good bed. PERFECT!Would definitely stay there again, If I can get the same rate. ($150, 50% off)

Located very centrally a short distance from Tokyo station. Good sized rooms, but the problem is an old hotel not modernised and tpp many rooms - cant handle the daily breakfast crowds. Average brekker

The hotel is very large. I shared a room with a colleague and the room was quite spacious. The breakfast was very good. The drinks in the bar very expensive. The staff did not speak English very well but it was sufficient.

The tokyo dome hotel is just beside the sports stadium. Their is also a park very near. Malls are connected to the hotel. Train station where you can go around tokyo is just walk away. Restaurant is in the 3rd floor, you go out and explore different foods just outside the hotel. Shopping malls during my visit march, closes 7:30pm some until 9pm. If you are tourist some shopping malls have tax refund some are not. I am little bit confuse of the floor, our room is at 2002 but its in 22th floor.

The hotel staff are really nice. The neighborhood around the hotel has more of a residential feel, but there a mall connected to it. It's for connections to the Tokyo Metro and then around the city.There is a safe in the room, but it is too small for a laptop, except maybe a smaller one. There is a sign that says to shower with the door closed otherwise the fire alarm will go off. A couple of days I forgot to do so and no issues. The bathroom is efficient and pretty nice with a strong shower that heats up faster than any shower I have been in.The hotel is so tall, that on a high floor, you are guaranteed to have views of something. The glass elevator ride up is neat experience too as you go high above the dome.And best of all, the hotel is very affordable for Tokyo.

Stayed 9 nights. Pricing varies day. So some days cheap weekends not. Nice clean room. Best beds and pillows I have had in any hotel and have stayed at a few. So mean this a high compliment. Room also had hot water maker and tea provided for free. Mimi bar and coffee extra charge. Our stay included breakfast which was buffet style and amazing. Selection of western and Asian options, cold and all very well prepared. Location was great to get to metro and JR line. Stations very close. Being around Tokyo Dome meant Attractions, shopping and a variety of restaurants (Asian, western and baseball themed) were on our doorstep.Staff are friendly and helpful. Wifi was great most of the day with streaming working fine. Only reasons not giving 5 stars is the power situation in the room. 2 plugs available in the room room, 1 in bathroom and 1 for hot water. No USB ports. Travelling with phones and other electronics needing charging meant rotating. And no power near beds meant you can charge your phone and use as alarm. Was expecting more in a modern hotel

This was a super convenient location for a night game at the Tokyo Dome and I hoped to do some shopping at the nearby stores in the morning. However, the nearby mall didn't even open until 11:00. So, instead we went to the nearby (other side of the Dome) Koishikawa Kōrakuen Garden which is a must see and absolutely beautiful. Staff at hotel was very polite and helpful. We arrived early before check-in and they took our bags and gave us a claim ticket for when we returned. We stayed on the 16th floor overlooking the Dome. Great view.

We visited the bar on the 43rd floor of the Tokyo Dome Hotel in the hope of getting some decent cocktails whilst enjoying a nice night-time view over the city. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. There is a hefty cover charge if you wish to be seated in the main cafe bar area. We don't like jazz and had already eaten so opted to stay in the bar area outside the cafe. It felt as if we were second class citizens! The bar prices are not too bad in themselves, but the cocktails were disappointing, as was the ambience. The bar has two viewing areas - but you aren't allowed to sit at them, only stand! Not very comfortable with cocktails! One side of the bar is a smoking area - so essentially the whole of the bar is subject to smoke! We did not enjoy it at all. Such a disappointment. A few other hotel guests came up for the view while we were there are promptly left after seeing the set up and smelling the smoke. If you're after a view, try the free viewing platforms at the National Metropolitan Building instead!

I return to this hotel year after year for an annual event in January, at the neighboring Tokyo Dome. The rooms are small but simple, and the view makes up for any lack of space. The bathrooms are again... small but high quality. I always get the package including breakfast, then alternate between the breakfast buffet and the Japanese restaurant option. There is a genuine effort by all the staff to provide the best service, even if there is an occasional language barrier. The hotel is also close to the train station. There is a lovely public garden a few blocks to the west. I take the bus from Narita directly to the hotel which is also very easy. I will stay here again. Many thanks to the staff for excellent service year after year.

RAGE|Rave.view  NAME: Tokyo Dome Hotel LOCATION: Tokyo, Japan (Bunkyo) TIME OF YEAR: March 13 RATING: 4/5 PRICE: Included with tour RESERVATION: Yes QUALITY: Decent accommodations LENGTH: 1 night RAVE: Toilets RAGE: No time for amusement park LOWDOWN: We stayed here one night on our week long Golden Route Cherry Blossom tour with All Japan Tours. Mostly all the toilets in Japan are electronic. The toilet in our room had all types of buttons that did who knows what (they were in Japanese but the images gave us some idea) and were heated. Breakfast was included which was a mix of Japanese and western choices. There is an amusement park which is part of the hotel but we did not get to go as we had to continue our tour. There are Ferris wheels and small amusement parks all around the cities we visited in Japan. RAGE|Rave.view

review_body: Good quality hotel on a convenient location in tokyo.My first stay here, but I will for sure stay here again next time.Good bed, clean room and bathroom, free wifi.Nice reception staff, good guest service!!Both airports can be reached by bus service

Very nice hotel.Rooms very spacious, beds comfortable, dining options were variedWhen working at the Tokyo Dome aka the big egg, this the best place to stay.Staff is awesome . You can't go wrong with either breakfast option, I prefer the Japanese fixed breakfast over the super buffet

Brilliant location, close to entertainment districts and on subway. This hotel is close to a Spa and shopping mall as well as, of course, Tokyo Dome and the adventure park. The hotel itself is spacious and comfortable, if in need of a little updating.

Very pleasant! Central location in Tokyo. Helpful and friendly personnel. Very big hotel, spacious rooms, great views from the top restaurant as well as most of the rooms... next to shops and restaurants, very near a subway - train station.

Just arrived to Tokyo Dome Hotel and so far has been a bad experience. As soon as I arrived, the person who made the check in did not even look at me and say "hi" he looked at his computer and say "passport" and had a bad attitude during the entire check in process. I was surprise by this specially in Japan where people service is impeccable. He gave me a smoking room without telling me, after drag my luggage I get in the room smelling like cigarettes. I had to go back down and complain so they prepare another room however the only one available had a worst view. It's been disappointing so far. Will update review after I check out.

Standing next to the Dome Stadium and Fairground this an excellent hotel for the businessman teavelling with a family with Children. The hotel has a swimming pool, the rooms are larger than the very small rooms found in some other hotels. Buffet breakfast is excellent and wireless is impeccable.

Nice hotel in Tokyo. Very reasonable prices. Adjacent to Tokyo Dome Stadium and Toyota Headquarters. Convenient and clean. Attentive service. Rooms are clean and good size for business travel. No English language TV.

Enjoyed our stay at the Tokyo Dome Hotel. We stayed here while attending the Tokyo international quilt show. Lovely location. Easy access to the dome, many restaurants and shopping near by. Easy access to other parts of the city. Very nice room. Would stay here again.

Rooms are a little dated but the staff were super friendly. Cool bar on the top floor with stunning views and easy access to the metro... Went for the whole Tokyo city immersion thing and thought it was good value for money overall.

I stayed here for the better part of a week. Part business and part vacation. The hotel is directly next to the Tokyo Dome arena, as well as Tokyo Dome City, a shopping mall quite a large hotel , with multiple restaurants . The food was good in either, though boring at Sizzlers as the buffet was the same every day.

Arriving at the Dome Hotel we were optimistic about staying. The location and view of the park looked beautiful and the lobby was in excellent condition. Originally my husband and I had booked to come with our daughter but when our daughter couldn't make I emailed the hotel a few weeks in advance just to let them know we would just be travelling as a couple. While I didn't expect a room change I did at the same time request a double or king bed (which I have done many times before at numerous hotels where they often push two twins together for couples). On check-in, the ladies had no prior knowledge of our daughters cancellation until I showed them the confirming email. They then asked about the bed configuration for my husband and I and said we requested one bed. When we got to our room I was shocked to see they had literally just pushed one twin bed over to touch the next. The two single beds were individually made, but now they touched??!... The room overall was very dated for a four star hotel, scratches and marks covering the walls, 80's looking ill fitted chairs and bed covers (one with a stain). The rooms are quite hard to get at the right temperature and as there seems to be a inadequate working fan in the bathroom, the whole room fogs when we shower. On the positive side, the room (apart from the one bedcover) and bathroom is extremely clean and the view is amazing. Although if visiting Tokyo again I will look at what else I can get for $260 NZD a night.

The Tokyo Dome is a well located hotel in the Bunko Ward Office of Tokyo, on the crossroads of the Toei Mita & Chu Main Line stations. I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions while staying in Tokyo on business and the level of service and quality is constantly excellent! Room sizes are generous for a Japanese hotel, although the bathroom dimensions are more typically Japanese but well appointed, so unless you are under 4ft do not expect to stretch out in the bath!The hotel is actually part of a larger Tokyo Dome Complex that includes the hotel, the Tokyo Dome and Tokyo Dome City attractions. The City attractions is a leisure complex that incorporates theme park rides, restaurants and an Irish bar. Unlike many leisure complexes the food is typically excellent the drinks unexpansive, should you wish to leave the hotel but don't fancy venturing too far. The centre of the complex is the Tokyo Dome which is a baseball stadium and 50,000 seat music venue! Events at the venue have a big impact not only on the crowds outside the hotel but variation in price. During this stay prices fluctuated between GBP 101 - 164 p/n due to a popular act playing at the Dome. Price wise however the Dome Hotel represents a reasonable price for room size and location. Most people traveling to Japan (myself include) are first pleasantly surprised or even amazed at how everything runs so well to schedule, but remember for this to work you will be expected to maintain the same discipline! Therefore early check in (especially if no forewarning is given) is likely to be refused & check out times are strictly adhered to! Hotel transfer from either Haneda or Narita is simple with the option of either the limo bus or train network which both run like clockwork. Transfer by taxi is possible but expect to pay roughly £140 from Narita and is only marginally quicker. The hotel has two main restaurants for breakfast these being Westerner (ish) and Japanese, the quality and quantity of the food is excellent, but during longer stays can become a little repetitive. With so many local restaurants offering and excellent and varied choice of food I have rarely eaten in the hotel, when I have the food however has been first class and I couldn't fault the Tempura set menu at Yugo-an Tankuma.There are negatives but they are small! Drinks cost at are not insignificant but pricing is upfront and clear, areas of the hotel are little warn and in need of a re-fresh and the efficiency of the air conditioning varies throughout the day. In room TV is typical of most Japanese hotels in as far as you may find an English channel, but then again you may not and if you do you are never quite sure how long it will stay in English. This is a very narrow minded complaint (being in Japan after all) but it’s something you miss especially on longer visits None of these points however are major issues or would give me any reason to think twice about booking again in the future

Stayed 2 nights in this hotel while my last business trip to Tokyo. My room was 15th floor Tokyo dome view side.1. AmenitiesFirst thing I look at was amenities and they are well organized and fully serviced once you are out of it. 2. Cleaning You barely see hotel service members but room always kept in clean. I guess staffs are ninja master. 3. location There are metro just near this hotel so very approachable. Also I heard the location is just center of the city. 4. ViewView is one of the best city view among I have ever been to. Especially night view is fantastic if you are staying in Tokyo Dome side. 5. Ice machineThey even got a ICE Machine in each floors!!! This is awesome feature I have never expected.

Tokyo Dome located right next to the Dome. Huge and luxurious. But inside, the bed room’s setting and decoration were typical business hotel, no unique Japanese aroma.Hotel internet: free in room wi-fi.Hotel dinner: Buffet style. Gigantic dining hall. Foods/dishes were deluxe and bounteous. One of the best.Hotel breakfast: Plain.

The 5 stars go to Location, Views and Atmosphere of this hotel. Rooms could be very small depending on the rate you pay. They now have wifi in the rooms, which is good. Rooms could be loud during major concerts and games in the dome. While the breakfast buffet in the main restaurant is below average, there is a good choice of restaurants inside and around the hotel. They charge you for the coffee in the room. Get a higher floor double occupancy room with good view and enjoy your stay. This is my first choice when visiting the area for business, there is always something going on in Tokyo Dome.

the location is superb, walking distance to almost everything, convenience stores, restaurants, shopping, train station, even bus to airport stop in front of the hotel. love it. would definitely recommend this hotel.

We choose tokyo dome hotel because it is one of the pick up station for day trips ( if you plan day trip to places like hakone or Mt fuji from sunrise tour or japanican.com), the room is relatively ok, abit old, staff is frenly and helpful. Location is great as many convenient shops and food stalls around beside the fun park for kids. It is just few mins walk from suidobashi station.

Staying at Tokyo dome hotel, one of the tallest around Tokyo area. Room is spacious and there a working desk that is facing the city from the 9th floor. The hotel is near to Tokyo dome city and is easy to access anywhere from suidobashi station. And it Christmas season... Would be good to be here with loves one to enjoy Japan in the winter...

It's a serious good hotel with great service and a perfect location in Tokyo.Many train lines are coming there together so very easy to get around.But also tour and trips are being arranged from the Hotel.On top of that it is next to the sports Dome so when you have the change to watch a came please do. Good restaurants in the area. A real fun location.Rooms and service etc are outstanding good.

If you are planning to go to Tokyo and prefer not to be in the central shopping area, then Tokyo Dome Hotel in Bunkyo area is an option for you.Lots of good restaurants nearby, train and subway stations almost at your doorstep, an a theme park beside if you are bringing along your kids with you.The rooms are spacious in terms of Tokyo room standards. The staff are very helpful.The only advise I can give you is that you check-in within the check-in times, or else you get to be charged for early check-in.

Went here to visit a friend who was staying on the 32nd floor. Amazing hotel, great looking room and Skylar at 42nd floor is recommended for it's stellar views. Especially during the evening when the city is lit up

Stayed here for our first night after arriving from the uk on a business trip and we were really pleased with the hotel, the location and everything about it. Rooms are good size which isn't as common in Japan and facilities were more than adequate. The hotel is located next to the dome obviously and this makes for great entertainment t should you want or need it. Only downside for me was the price of food in the restaurants, it seemed very over priced for what it was but a weak pound v the yen wasn't helping I know

Its a very beautiful hotel, located in the city center area. The rooms are spacious according to the Tokyo hotel standards. Staff is very helpful. Location is convenient to the stations near for the JR line.The breakfast is a huge affair. Lots of choices. Reception area is very huge.All in all a very pleasant and a memorable hotel stay in Tokyo.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Given the cost (£95-a-night double room), I expected very little apart from its convenient location for the rest of Tokyo. The location is great - there are convenience stores within a 2 minutes walk from the hotel, plus many restaurants are within 5 minutes in the Tokyo Dome Park. It is a 25 minute walk to the gardens and parks in Chiyoda. There are quite a few train lines nearby: a couple within 2 mins, another within 10. It was easy for me to travel by subway to Haneda airport (50 mins in total, 1 change at Mita). I knew most of this before booking. However, I was surprised by the attractiveness of the hotel interior, such as the lobby and the bar/restaurants. I also thought the service I received from the staff was superb. For example, without asking I was provided a newspaper at my door in the morning, and staff took my suitcases to my room on arrival in the lobby. I was also happy with the size of the room. My room also had a great view of the Tokyo Dome area (see attached photo). There were a couple of minor things that stop me from saying the hotel is perfect. One is that the room was not as modern as the rest of the hotel. It was acceptable (very clean, comfortable bed, good shower), but certainly you would not expect the decor to look the way it does if you were to guess from seeing the lobby. The other is that the room did not provide facilities to make more than one cup of coffee per day. They charged 210 yen to use the coffee filter for this one cup too. This is not ideal. I would definitely stay again. My colleagues stayed in different hotels, some paid more than me, others paid less, but none of their experiences were as positive as mine.

Dome Hotel is located near the city center, in the crossroads of JR line and the Mtro Mita lines which let you get to Tokyo station, Shinjuku or Ueno in a short time. Rooms are the biggest among the price range below 150 USD I have ever had in Tokyo and they reward you with great city views. I also love the spacious and clean bathroom. The other great point is the service you get at reception, very, very professional. The area around has an attraction park with restaurants and a shopping mall and... the sports stadium. Good discovery

This is an excellent hotel. From my extensive travelling experience, I would rate this as a 5 star hotel. There are plenty of staff who are always asking how they can help you. My room was on the 36th floor with panoramic views of Tokyo. The Hotel is located near an underground railway station.

I stayed in this hotel in end of October.Was Travelling solo for work.No complaints regarding the room and service. There was a decent bfast also available in mornings. Staff was as usual very polite and helpful. It's near to the train station and you can be in Shinjuku in 10-15 mins.Will visit again

I have been many times in this hotel over the past 15 years, as my business is close to it. The rooms are always nice and very clean and although they did not change over all this time they are up to standard. There is a lot of staff around but the service level is not that high, also because of lack of English knowledge. The wifi is too limited for business purpose and does not allow to connect to office VPN. This is an absolute minus. Also the fact that I wanted to leave after the (too early) limit of 11am and I had informed upfront I had to pay 1.000Yen for my check out at 11:20. Some flexibility of staff might have been nice.

After several travels in Japan I must say that this is a real great place where to stay, if you're in Tokyo central area, while cost of the hotel is not really too high, also considering the very beautiful position and location of this hotel.It is very close by to the metro, able to reach any main transport hubs of this mega city; when you're flying to Narita airport, there's a bus service which you can exploit to reach easily your next flight.Rooms are good for Japan in terms of available space. The view from your room is generally impressive independently from the side (Tokyo dome side or opposite).Last but not least the breakfast is superb! You've any choice: sweet, salty, western style, Japanese style.. furthermore the quality is very high.No need to highlight that the service and support from the hotel crew is always amazing.

The rooms are big by Tokyo standards. The rooms could do with a little attention but are fine, clean, good air condetc. I had a little tussle to get a non-smoking room but after that I was fine. The rate was cheap as booked by a local but there was no breakfast included. Still, breakfast abounds around the Dome. this was a good location for me so suited me absolutely fine being so close to Suidobashi station for the Tokyo underground and the line to Akihbara etc

Location is good, near subway and close to many landmarks in Tokyo like Tokyo Dome, Ueno, and Akihabara with distance of 4-5 subway stations. Further just round the back corner of the hotel, you can enjoy shopping around at Tokyo Dome City as well as Don Quijote with only less than 10 minutes walking.Room is spacious, clean with good wifi connection. When booking, please do check if you do not smoke since more than 70% of rooms here are smoking type.Staffs do speak English at the certain level, and all of them are willing to give a helping hands upon request.Breakfast facilities are great, there are 2 coffee shops avail, one on 3rd., and the other on 4th.Room rate wise is okie, totally value for money, say a hotel like this at this spending. Mine was around US$ 100 plus at corporate rate.

I think it is perfect for quick business trips as it's very conveniently located and reasonably priced. The only thing I recommend is not to have breakfast at their buffet place as it's overpriced and not good. Other than that it's a great hotel.

This hotel in Tokyo was very pleasant modern and clean with great views of the dome and rides or the city. We found the location to be very nice and central and you were literally only 30 minutes away from just about anything in Tokyo.The staff were very helpful and pleasant the rooms were nice and clean with fairly modern bathrooms and comfortable beds. The staff did not wake you up early to clean the rooms and we found that all were very peasant and let you just get on with your holiday.The only point of note is that the swimming pool is an outdoor one and they close it in October so we could not use it even if we wanted to.There is plenty to do around the hotel if you cannot be bothered to venture far with lots of restaurants available inside or around the hotel in Tokyo Dome city. There are also some very good more traditional eateries across the road we had a great steak in a restaurant where you have to stand up to eat - typically Japanese but a great experience none the less.Not much else to say really other than i would highly recommend this hotel and if i go back would be very happy to stay here again.

Hotel was well-located with easy access to several rail lines. There is a good Japanese foodcourt and lots of restaurants nearby. It was a convenient place for our holiday trip with two young children. The Tokyo Dome theme park was a bit of a letdown; the rides were old-fashioned and expensive. However, the children's play gym (Aso Bonno) and the Super Sentai live show (weekends only) are worth visiting. Your children will thank you.Our room was a bit dated but clean and comfortable. No kids channels on television and the wifi in the room was too slow to stream Youtube videos.The hotel wifi was free but terrible. I had to walk around the hotel to find a place with a stable connection (I use a VPN to connect to the office). I ended up in the basement next to the lifts. I stayed in two different rooms on different floors during the week and it was the same both times.Other than the wifi, I found the hotel stay satisfactory but will probably choose a different hotel in the future to see other parts of the city.

Good location & rooms of a good size for Tokyo, location is good for the dome & roller coaster, shopping a bit limited, but some good places to eat locally. Hotel has all you need for a good stay, shuttle bus to airports good value and makes getting to airport easier than public transport. Stations in walking range if you need public transport & coffee shops local to hotel for a cheep start to the day. Staff helpful but limited English language.

This is a busy hotel with a lot of tourist. Rooms are very clean. Rooms are good sized for Tokyo. The airport limo bus stops here so you can make direct connections from Narita and Haneda which I did. The breakfast was excellent but make sure you include it in your room rate. I could hear the noise in the room above me which disturbed my sleep. I asked for a fan but the hotel did not have. I could not get foam pillows only feather or buckwheat. The elevators are fast but there can be a que at busy times. The hallways are too warm but the room AC worked well. The internet worked well.

I stayed 3 nights at the Tokyo Dome Hotel as I was planning to attend a 2 night concert at the Dome.The hotel is meters away so extremely convenient for concerts or baseball games.I arrived early and as always in Japan, they enforce the 2PM check in time strictly. But unlike others, they had an early check in option for 2.000 yens which was not cheap but I was a bit tired and needed my room.Staff was always present, helpful and polite.My room on the 24th floor was spacious by Japanese standards and comfortable if a bit dated.For breakfast I visited once the International buffet which was very busy but had quite a few options on offer. The second morning I went for the Japanese set option and was no disappointed, I wish I had done that the previous day.The hotel has a limousine bus stopping at the entrance to get to either airports, I took it to Narita, it was fast, efficient and no need to carry your luggage through Tokyo's buzy metro / train stations.

I stayed with two friends for one night in this hotel. Compared to many other hotel rooms in Japan, the three-bed room was very spacious. Also, the bathroom was rather large and had a full tub, whereas other Japanese hotel only contain a small shower stall for bathing. You'll get a great view of Tokyo from riding the elevators, are they are glass-enclosed. If you're from the U.S., Great Britain, Canada, Australia, or another primarily English speaking country, most of the hotel employees speak English well, certainly better than I speak Japanese. They were able to help me arrange a ride to Haneda Airport and assist me in mailing a package through Japan Post. In terms of its staffing level, this hotel is very guest-focused. When you enter the lobby, there were always several employees available and ready to help answer questions. Although I'm no expert in the geography of Tokyo, the location felt very central to the city. JR and Tokyo Metro stations are nearby. Also, as the name hints, the Tokyo Dome sports facility is easily within walking distance, as are restaurants, convenience stores, a bowling alley and a post office. A gift shop is conveniently located on the second floor. One possibly negative thing I will say about this hotel is that the restaurants contained with the hotel are rather expensive, though that's more of a comment on the restaurants located within the hotel, as opposed to the hotel itself. If you're going to Haneda or Narita Airport following your stay, I recommend going to the concierge and buying a bus ticket to the aiport. It's about 1,130 yen (11.15 U.S. dollars) to go to Haneda, and about 3 times as much to go to Narita, but still may very well be worth the expense.

My family and I stayed at the tokyo dome hotel for 5 nights and we loved it there, great hotel, great staff, great location, it was just amazing and we will go back there hopefully next year! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to tokyo!!!!

Hotel was right infront of Tokyo Dome stadium where we wanted to watch EXO in concert. It was fairly easy to get to from the airport however, the walk from the train station especially Kurokuen was daunting with luggage. Staff were very polite & helpful. We got a high floor for our room & it was nice. Pretty spacey.

The hotel is well positioned and is at the foot of Tokyo Dome so there are lots of places to eat and things to do. The downside is that rooms are tiny and are dated, they look they have not been refreshed in 20 years, the aircon even on high power mode takes 20 minutes to cool the room when you come in. There is no gym at the hotel which is a major issue to people who want to live a healthy lifestyle whilst travelling. The hotel is keen to tell you about a nearby gym that you need to pay for but they do not advise that it closes at 6pm so its not suitable for anyone on a business trip.

I have never seen a hotel with so many staff strategically placed around the lobby. You can't move an inch without one asking to help you which would be good if they could understand English well. Nevertheless the staff are willing to help though not too helpful at the end as they don't need to have much knowledge. For instance we were given tourist information but neglected to be told that the museum we were about to visit was closed on the day. On the plus side, the views are fabulous from the higher floors. The room was very clean and well maintained. The breakfast was too expensive. But there are a lot of restaurants around the vicinity. If you are into baseball the stadium is right next to the hotel. Very close to subway station. Overall good experience.

Tokyo Dome Hotel was great and exceeded my expectations! I had a great view of the Tokyo Dome and La Qua. It is not too far from many of the must-sees of Japan. The rooms are very clean and the staff are friendly as well. Would definitely stay again!

Tokyo Dome Hotel is one of my favorite places to stay in Tokyo. Located next to the baseball stadium and lots of entertainment right behind the hotel. Good access to the subway station. Very clean and well kept hotel. Customer service is great but this is Japan. I can honestly say I have never had bad customer service here or anywhere in Japan! My only complaint about Tokyo Dome Hotel is that the hotel controls the air conditioning. During certain times of year (spring & winter & fall). There is a master on/off switch for all AC. If the hotel thinks you do not need AC you do not get AC (depending on outside temp). Westerners who are used to cold AC at all times may be disappointed. The hotel has a great bar and many restaurants! Bar 2000 on the 6th floor is one of my all time favorites. Great views, great drinks but the price is a bit expensive.

I stay in this hotel during my business tour, and a find a great sky bar with good cocktails a also good restaurant, just last time for the breakfast one morning there were many people and i didn't take my breakfast, i hope next time more organization

Stopped in and had a delicious & expensive lunch in the tea room in the lobby. The hotel is very big and plush with a gorgeous oriental modern design but the lobby bathrooms are something else, very dirty. Judging from the cost of my Coca Cola Zero which assisted my lunch with a whopping cost of ¥800 which would be €8, this hotel is probably very expensive and would not suit people with a budget

My stay at Tokyo Dome was great and I would recommend others to stay there.First of all, the room is quite spacious for hotels in Tokyo and comfortable.I requested for a high floor and they offered me a room with a nice view ! The location is easily accessible by subway as it is right in front of the subway station called Suidobashi.Although it was my first time to go to Tokyo, I could travel around quite easily.Another thing that I enjoyed during my stay at Tokyo Dome Hotel is that the food court at Tokyo Dome City which is right next to the hotel and it takes 1-2mins to reach there !I preferred to trying local food than hotel breakfast so I went to the mall.There is a food court on the first floor and the Tacoyaki and rice with salmons on it, which i was told to pour their special soup onto it were super delicious! Other than this, there are a few restaurants you can explore at late night as well.Seven Eleven is just on the way to hotel from the subway so I bought a bottel of water every night as the hotel didn`t offer drinking water for free.Amenities are just ok. you might want to bring your own foam cleanser, shampoo etc.There is an Airport bus that goes to Narita & Haneda Airport from hotel as well.I found it really convenient.My stay at Tokyo Dome hotel was totally worth it !

The hotel is next to the Tokyo Dome so quite central and has three metro lines and one JR rail line in its vicinity. Shopping centre and an amusement park next to it, but the better restaurants are actually in the residential neighbourhood to the south. Good view since it is a high tower. Very clean, friendly staff, but that is to be expected in Japan. WiFi signal strength was average. Not the most soundproof rooms. The price was ok, but the swimming pool is extra - 15 euros for a dip!!

We requested a non smoking room, guess what they put us in a smoking room, without our knowledge. Once we were on the floor we found out and it took them couple hours to find us another room. We booked the hotel knowing that it has a swimming pool, but shocked to find out that as a hotel guest you have to pay to get in to swim. We will never ever come back to this hotel again.

Hotel is nice, with a very friendly staffLocation is great, you have a Limo bus stop in the hotel (To both main airports), you also have a subway station just in the corner and a train station just 2 blocks away.It is located very close to akihabara (Electronic district), just 2 train stops away.Also you have some convenience stores (7-11, Family Mart) and other stores like Dennys, MCDonalds, Subway or Starbucks within 1 block from the hotel.As it is a tower, views from the top floors are great!

Everything we wanted in an hotel... Friendly staff, clean room, easy access from the airport, not sure about the food side of things.... We didn't have the breakfasts that we paid for, because we were out too early every morning... Departing was easy, and efficient.... Strong recommendation....

A 2 minute walk to Suidobashi Train Station, so extremely convenient to those wanting to explore Tokyo as we did. The hotel itself was very modern, and the staff were lovely and friendly and very helpful. Most staff speak English which was fantastic. We stayed on the 26th floor with an awesome view over tokyo dome city. Room was small, but comfortable. We were a little disappointed in the buffet breakfast, as there was not much of a selection. Next time we will not pay the extra for brekky, as we found it to be overpriced for the selection that was available. Was very hot whilst we were there, so we went to the pool, only to read a sign which had entry prices on it - not free for guests!!! In room television was also disappointing, as you also had to pay extra for pay tv. In our experiences, we have never had to pay extra for cable TV.

This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in Japan so far. The location is perfect. The JR line station is just accross the street. There is a bridgeway that will lead you to the station. At the back of the hotel, there is a mall called LaQua which houses Uniqlo, Muji, ABC and a grocery store and a beauty store for cosmetics etc. There is also a spa/onsen. The restaurants are plenty with many good selections. Babagump, Fridays, Ramen house, bakery, rotating sushi , tokiyaki balls, starbucks, tully's, Baskin and Robbins... Name it. You'll never go hungry. Very near the area, beside the Richmond hotel is every traveller's find...Don Quijote store where you can practically buy anything to bring back home. Green tea, chocolates, noodles, my favorite Tsubaki shampoo, toys, a lot of food and more at a very reasonable price. You can avail of it tax free by presenting your passport. But your items will be sealed and be opened when you get back to your home country. At the corner street, near the stop light, there is a Ramen house thatbis worth trying which is open until early morning. Going back to this hotel, at the reception, there is an english speaking staff who is ready ready assist. The lobby is vast with couches to stay while waiting. The rooms are spacious and clean and of course, the WC has a heated toilet seat and all those push button bidet and deodorizer which I enjoy in Japan. They do not provide with botteled water since the water from the faucet is ready and safe to drink. The breakfast in Rilasso has a variety of choices but you can also try the Japanese breakfast on the 4th floor. I would love to stay in this hotel again when I come back to Japan.

We stayed here on two separate occasions during our trip to Japan! Really really really comfortable beds and pillows!I found it interesting that on our first night stay we accidentally booked a soaking floor and our room/bed was actually bigger than the night we spent in a non smoking room, but we paid the same amount! The bathroom was spacious as we're both bedrooms! Hotel check-in was very easy and we had little trouble communicating with their staff. We had dinner on the last night at their restaurant on the 43rd floor which had spectacular views! I recommend making a booking and paying an extra 500yen for a small booth with great views of the city! Food was reasonably priced - wine ...... Not so much!

The hotel is centrally located and very close to the JR line. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. The room was modern, a good size, clean, very comfortable and had all the necessary amenities. We overlooked the Tokyo Dome which was lit up at night. The breakfast area is huge and offers a very good selection of all types of food (including western style food). Keep in mind that due to the size of the hotel, there may be a line-up for breakfast.

Tokyo Dome Hotel was amazing! Absolutely fantastic location, only a short ride from the train station and right next to Tokyo Dome City and the baseball stadium. Lots of really cool places to check out around Tokyo Dome City, you could probably spend a day there if you wanted to stretch it out. Shops, restaurants, arcades etc. Was really fun to walk around and check everything out.Our room was great, was nice & spacious and super comfortable bed. We had a great view of Tokyo dome city from our room!Bathroom facilities were great, a little on the small side but definitely not complaining! You can't go to Japan and expect huge bathrooms lol!Staff were amazing and so helpful!

I stayed for 5 nights in a 22nd floor room with twin beds and a great view of the Tokyo Dome. Spacious by Japanese standards with the usual amenities. Coffee was not free though. The hallway carpets needed cleaning or replacement, smelling of cigarette. The lobby was expansive! A lot of water features inside and out. The restaurants served great food. Buffet breakfast offering was fairly extensive. The Japanese restaurant served kaiseki and washoku dishes.

We stayed here on tour, so did not pay individually for the room. The charge is au$400 a night. The room is spacious with comfortable beds and fabulous views. It is in an excellent location. There is free wifi. Staff speak Englsih. The choice at the buffet breakfast was good. Perfect if you are going to the Dome. Laguna is a couple of minutes away.the rooms are quiet

Its easy to reach this hotel from the airport, just take limousine airport bus and the bus will directly take you to the hotel lobby. The room is nice, small but enough for me, the bathroom not to big but functional. Hotel location near the suidobashi station, very easy to go anywhere. Also a walk away to seven eleven or starbuck. For breakfast they provide two different style of breakfast, western ( on 3rd floor )and japanese ( on 4th floor ), western is buffet style and japanese is serve with set menu, your choice. Pool only open seasonaly.Thats is for my review, please enjoy

Great place and train is accessible. Would come back in my next visit. Left my other luggages when i visited Osaka and Kyoto for several days without any problem. Staff are very helpful and rooms cleaned as requested.

Nice modern hotel with nice good-sized room. Location provides many transit options. Immediately adjacent to the Dome for events. Plenty of options for dining and entertainment off all sorts. Staff friendly and attentive. No swimming pool open in warm late May.

I was surprised at the size and presentation of the twin room on the 31st floor. Excellent bathroom with the glamorous Japanese toilet and comfortable beds. The view was great and it is located close to JR and subway stations just across the road. The big bonus is that you are right on the doorstep of the La Aqua amusement park which as all sorts of rides for the young and old what fun. Also in the park are excellent shops and restaurants including a Moomin cafe which was quite a novelty. Also there is a beautiful park at the rear to enjoy.

Staff are very well trained to be polite, helpful and efficient. I stayed four nights. The more I got used to the transport access, the better I appreciated the location.I had a good view. The interior may be a littletired, but the large room size, good view are much better than a modern small hotel room. Waiting time for Elevator access was sometimes frustrating.I certainly recommend the hotel to friends, especially with children.

This hotel is very near to metro, restaurants, shopping mall, stadium etc. Have no idea about breakfast as i have not taken breakfast here in hotel. Rooms are decent good in size and good. Higher floors after 27th comes with a nice view of the area both morning and night. Most of the staff speaks english and are helpful. A recommended hotel to stay.

This was a most convenient and comfortable place to stay being close to trains, theme park, street shopping, a shopping mall and of course the Dome Stadium. I was on the thirteenth floor in a spacious and well appointed room. Reliable free Wi-Fi was available on the reception floor however there was a charge to have access in your room. You may need to queue to get to breakfast however the wide selection of food was very good.Language was not a problem.

accessible to metro completed with restaurants nearby. Next to a shopping mall and a stadium. Breakfast was okay but can get really crowded. Only downside was the lift - if you're staying on a lower floor and on the day of check out there's huge group of people checking out as well - you may have to wait very long to get an available lift down to the counter.Room size was okay, not too small to begin with. Higher floors can get you a nice view of the area both morning and night.Most of the staff speaks english so it was rather easier to navigate around the premises.

This hotel well located within a stone's throw from Suidobashi Station on JR and Mita line, and Korakuen Station on Marunouchi line. Very convenient if you like that part of gigantic Tokyo. The hotel, itself, has nothing particular, although clean, with lots of rooms. Sometimes, large groups come and go like revolving doors. Information staff are very efficient, giving you lists of near-by eateries. It has several in-house restaurants and bars . The main bar is not good value for money except a good view. The French restaurant has very reasonable prices of both food and wine. Worth giving a go.

The Dome is a good standard 3-and-a-half to 4 star property, well situated in Central Tokyo, with metro and JR stations almost adjacent. The lobby is 5-star and impressive, and the rooms are clean and well-appointed, but only one English TV channel is available (CNN). There are a number of decent low-cost restaurants adjacent, and the big baseball stadium is just behind the hotel. The hotel is huge, with (I think) about 900 rooms and is greatly used by tour groups, so is often full. The lifts are simply not up to the demand made upon them when this is so, and you can wait for a long time to go in either direction as full lifts pass you over and over again at peak times. Breakfast is served in a very large restaurant and the offering is excellent, but be aware that you may have to line up for quite a while to get a table.

My wife and I had 2 days at this wonderful hotel, from the balcony I could see the beautiful view of Tokyo at night, it was perfect. Though we had to wait for a long line to get into the restaurant but the meal was good and fresh, everything in the room was awesome and modern, wifi is free at the lobby. The hotel's location is nice, we just needed to go through the bridge to the mall. We are really pleased and impressed with this hotel.

Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: Most of the staff there speak English well which is very convenience for the foreigners. Very convenience place for traveling around and to and fro airport too. Except that there is a gap time during the day that there is no airport service which we need to use other means to travel to hotel. There is a shopping mall with restaurant closed by. And the food at the restaurant is also reasonably good.

Its recommended, because the hotel is clean and comfortable with good wifi connection. I had a room with great view too. Value for money. The staff are friendly. Near by - shopping areas, food areas, and metro.

I was a little concerned about staying at a non-brand name hotel during our trip to Tokyo as I'd heard/read that many of the hotel rooms in Japan are a lot smaller compared to American hotels. However, this was not the case with the Tokyo Dome Hotel. Our entire experience at the hotel was excellent. I would compare the hotel to a Marriott Renaissance in a large US city. The staff upon check in spoke plenty of English to get us oriented and checked in. We received a complimentary upgrade to the 'Excellency Floor" which included lounge access which was great for a quick snack on arrival night and for breakfast the following morning (it was a great continental breakfast with yogurt, fruits, pastries, etc.)The room was spacious, well lit with a big window with a fantastic view and the bathroom was above average. I will say the bed was a little hard but that may be a cultural difference and it also didn't matter since we were exhausted from all the travel. This was a great place to stay since we were attending a baseball game at the Dome that night and was a few minutes walk to the park and then again to the Koishikawa Korakuen Garden the next morning as it is right next door as well. Finally, the hotel had easy access to a metro station so you're easily connected to the rest of the city. We had a great stay and if we travel back to Tokyo again I would certainly look into staying here again.

Well located in town of Bunkyo. JR & Metro just within walking distance make travelling around Tokyo very easy. There is a amusement park right next to the hotel known as Tokyo Dome City. There is a baseball museum & baseball fan store at the Dome next to the hotel. There is also a shopping complex known as Laqua next to the amusement park. Variety of restaurants located nearby. Hotel buffet breakfast is nice with lots of choices. Hotel staffs are very helpful and friendly. The room is very clean and comfortable. The view of the room facing the park make it very nice at night with all lights on.

We stayed at the Tokyo Dome hotel for a period of 6 days over the sakura season. We were at the 11th floor and the double room was a perfect size for my family of 4 (the hubby, myself and two young toddlers). It overlooked the Tokyo Dome and my toddlers especially had such a wonderful time every night just sitting in front of the window looking out at the amusement park just next door and enjoying the night lights. The Tokyo Dome was just next to the hotel and we even managed to catch our first ever baseball game (Giants vs the Tigers!) and had such a fun time just being there with the passionate fans - and it felt so good to be able to walk right back to our hotel room thereafter :) It is conveniently located in between the JR and Sobu lines and we took the train everywhere we went! The concierge staff spoke really good English and were able to guide us whenever we were nearly lost. The hotel is a little old but it's very clean, and at a fantastic location - and that to me is of paramount importance. We can't wait to return again to the Tokyo Dome Hotel!

Located in Tokyo entertainment meca of Suidobashi. Also has one of the best gardens in Tokyo just 100 metres away. The Dome is a skip from the back door. Many fine eateries in the hotel. A 30 story fairest wheel and a mind blowing Rollercoaster is also with in a 100 meter. So I am saying great location. Tokyo and shin juku are only minutes away by subway. Now for the hotel. Very Japanese in manner meaning you are treated like royality. That is tipical of the custom service one receives in Japan. So the staff are always at their Japanese best. Room are super comfortable and large and super clean with a great bathroom. Views are spectacular from all rooms. I had the dome side being a baseball lover just love it. Price was a bargin compare to say London, New York or Sydney. Like 100% less in price. I pay $ us 200 were any other big city would be triple the price. Yes back this hotel and you will be on a winner. The only bad experience I had is that my tigers loss to the giants and the short walk to the hotel amongst a winner tribe of giants fan seem like a 100 km instead of a 100 metres.

this is a nice, modern hotel situated next to tokyo dome city & stadium and 5 mins walk to Suidobashi station on both JR Chuo & Sobu Line ..lots of eateries in tokyo dome city and surrounding areas …there's also an amusement park and Koishikawa Korakuen Garden is just round the corner …room are decent in size… clean, comfortable and staff are friendly and helpful …this is a very big hotel and thus it is always very crowded with people but hotel staff are eagerly to assist and welcome you ...check-in time is stated at 3pm so if you arrive early, you cannot expect to have early check-in ..you can take airport limousine bus direct from hotel to narita and haneda airport .. it's very convenient … last bus depart to narita airport is 1440hrs and it takes less than an hour to reach ..this hotel is not situated in the circle of shopping areas like shinjuku or shibuya thus one must always travel out but it is not inconvenient because train system in tokyo is very effective and efficient …

We stayed as members of a group tour. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The bed was really good with soft, decent pillows. Try to get a view over the Tokyo Dome where there is a Ferris wheel and roller coaster lit up at night. Breakfast buffet was very good, catering for Western and Eastern alike. I could not fault the staff or property during our two night stay. It's right next to the Dome and perfect for special events held there. Close by are plenty of eating options covering all budgets. The underground is about 5 minutes walk away. A very nice hotel.

Perfect place if you plan to go to a Japanese baseball game. Adjacent to the Tokyo Dome stadium. Took me less than 5 minutes to walk from the stadium to my hotel room.My room was good size will all the amenities you would expect from a first class hotel.In addition, the staff if very friendly and helpful.

This is a decent hotel and a good value. Rooms are good and clean. Staff is good, but suffer from overwhelming crowds and, unfortunately, the problems associated (across Japan) with "Lost in Translation". I do recommend this hotel as a good value and availability at short notice. Breakfast was awesome, but do arrive 10 minutes before they open, because the lines get long. Thank you.

Small room , small bed, Better pay more and get comfortable room, my Freind speak Japanese and was Explaining regarding my request for the room, I try to explain more in English but the man at reception give signe by his hand (to shut up and not speak when he was speaking with my Freind)Very unpolite did not respect my age 58

Big hotel in convenient spot near two railway stations.Midsized rooms of a more western style. Everything you need in the room. Well kept fitout, clean, housekeeping meticulous.Several restaurants on site, many options within 300m.Great included buffet breakfast with western as well as asian offerings.Good strength free WiFi everywhere except level 2.Oodles of friendly helpful staff.Warning: this is a large multistory hotel geared to groups and people visiting for events at nearby dome. If you looking for character, smalltown feel, homeliness, Japanese style - probably not for you.

We spent 5 nights at the hotel and we thought it was a perfect spot for our Tokyo adventure. The room was a good size and it also had a fridge in the room. The beds were a fair size and over all the room was very clean. There is a 7-11 located just outside the hotel which is also next to a Starbucks and as well across the street is a Mcdonalds and as well the subway station is within 5 minutes from your room which will connect you to anywhere in the city. The hotel is connected to the Tokyo Dome which is like a amusement park with one big roller coaster and then lots of kids rides as well which our 3 year old son loved. There is also little games they can play like a ball shooter game or soccer ball kick and they have the chance to win a little small prize.You dont have to buy a pass to enter Tokyo Done its free to walk around as there is many food choices there as well even a supermarket. You can by a day pass for rides or you can purchase individual tickets per ride depending on how many you wanna go on. It was great to walk through and at night is all light up and super fun to walk around with all the lights. Overall the staff as super nice and the room was very good size and comfy for us and it was close t o the subway and 7-11 and made its location very convenient Id stay here again

Friendly and very helpful staff. Specially helping us to organize our trips and with explaining the confusing train map in Japan. Another highlight here is that the hotel is connected to restaurant area, a shopping center and a themed park. An amazing place for kids of all ages and of course adults with their roller coaster consider to be one of the best in Japan.
